name: Tom
location: All About Animals Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Yeah, my name is Tom, like 1,000 other male cats that have been outside. That is my story like a lot of other Toms .... was an outdoor cat and pretty much scoured the neighborhood for the attractive felines, eating whatever and whenever I could. Recently a nice foster family came along, they brought me inside, helped me get ready for adoption (neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, wormed, etc.), things I've never had done before. They have taken excellent care of me but they're saying that I need to find my own forever home. Let me tell you I certainly enjoy the indoor life now! I get food and water 24/7. I never have to search or scrounge for it anymore. No more digging through trash cans or climbing  trees to get that elusive bird. Believe me outdoor life is not really a fun life, so with that being said, I am going to be an indoor cat from now on and I am very content with that! So if you're looking for a handsome, studly, black, male cat (your typical Tom), that's got a heart of gold and a serious laid-back personality (yea I went from the Alley Cat Tom to a cuddly pushover ... heck I even LOVE all the other cats that are around me) then I'm your cat! Now dogs ... I'm still trying to get used to but with time that'll come too. I really don't have too much problem with them, I'm just not as comfortable with them as I am with other cats, you know I was chased by many so it's just gonna take some time to trust them all, but it'll happen.      Est. DOB  7/1/2021   Adoption Fee $100December 15, 2022, 9:54 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Tom, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story: Please meet Miss Marlee who made it out of county within 24 hours of losing her life thanks to her wonderful foster mom. Marlee is hearing impaired so she had no chance and now it is time for her life to begin  she is completely vetted and healthy and a truly beautiful girl. Because she is hearing impaired she should be an only dog until she has more training and she will do well with kids 12 and over.  She is just so CHILL! Her foster mom works long hours some days and everything is in it's place when she returns. No accidents and no counter surfing for this girl  'When my mom goes to bed, I like to sleep with her sometimes. But sometimes I go back to the sofa. I like to snuggle with my mommy when she's watching TV or reading. And when she's having a snack or something, while I give her my googly eyes, I respect her time and don't try to take her food at all. I also like to play and my favorite toy is a rope. When my mommy tosses it, I bring it back to her, so she can toss it again. I like going for walks and enjoy sunbathing, too. name: Winston
location: Paws 4 A Cause Arizona City: Cave Creek, AZ
story:
I may not be winning any fetch awards, but I will win over your heart with my snuggling skills. If a night of snacks, snuggling and sitcoms is your thing – we may be a perfect match. My name is Winston, and I am a nurtured 6-year-old German shepherd.
I know sit and drop it, for a treat I will even shake and lay down for you. I am OBBSSESED with my stuffed animals and I do great on a leash, even when other dogs yell at me, I just mind my own business. I sleep most of the day, but I very much enjoy my daily walks and going on bike rides with my foster family. I have lupus (this is a lifelong condition) which is why my nose looks the way it does so regular vet checkups are important for me. I would love a big back yard but have done great in the townhome I am currently living in. My foster mom loves to give me all kinds of hugs, kisses, and snuggles and I really enjoy that. I also love to help her cook in the kitchen (I love food, like really love it) and lay in her office all day while she works, I know I know, I am the ultimate companion.

I am not sure how well I do around young kids and other dogs, like I said…I REALLY love stuffed animals, so a small fluffy dog might confuse. I would really benefit from a quiet home where I can sleep and relax as I get older.  Older kids would be fine - say over 10.
Love - Winston If you have any questions or would like to adopt Winston, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story: This little girl will steal your heart! She loves to give kisses! Shes a very spirited girl and can be quite rambunctious and energetic! She loves to play rough and uses her mouth to play, this can be too much for less active dogs. She will need a strong leader and a lots of direction and boundaries to thrive and be clear of the expectations of her. She will do well to be kept active with a “job”, meaning she needs to feel like she has a purpose and an activity she is responsible for, otherwise she will create her own, and it is never what we would choose! She has been in training and that training will follow her, so you'll have guidance and support along the way. She has not done well around cats and we recommend no small pets or young children. story: Lemon is a very large boned cat.  He generally gets along with cats, dogs and humans, but he can be a bully to another cat.  He is exceptionally cuddly and easy to train.  More doglike than catlike. He has eosinophilic granuloma complex which is simply an autoimmune disorder.  He is not contagious.  He gets sores on his paws that are treated with spray and meds that come with him.  DOB 3/3/2020.  Adoption fee $100.December 15, 2022, 9:54 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Lemon, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: Jewel
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Is your family searching for the perfect diamond, ruby or sapphire? How about a Jewel? Jewel is a young, sweet and energetic girl with the most beautiful brindle coat. Not to mention, a pair of ears that make everyone around her say, “awwww!” Jewel loves to play, do agility and is truly one smart pup. She’s extremely eager to please, takes verbal commands very well, and is a fast learner. She would be an ideal agility dog, hiking buddy or just a fun pup to play fetch with. Oh, how could we forget!? Jewel loves water! This girl goes gaga for a play session with the hose. She is also super affectionate and loves to give kisses and get belly rubs. 

We have done some intros with her and other dogs and found that she can be dog selective. We will do intros with any dog that may be in her new family to ensure a perfect fit. 

Does Jewel sound like the perfect pup to join your pack? We hope so! We think she’s a “jewel.”
##1309515## If you have any questions or would like to adopt Jewel, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Samantha
location: All About Animals Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Samantha was born outside of her foster's apartment complex. Her mom had 3 babies who were always by the bushes near the parking lot. Each evening they waited for her foster to feed them. Her pregnant mother was humanly trapped and taken in by a rescue and adopted. Samantha was left on her own, and she made friends with a gray female cat who was also raised by her mother. After some months, she became pregnant. While heavily pregnant, the foster was finally able to catch her. Sadly, none of her 5 kittens survived. Samantha has slowly become more social and loving. She likes other cats and has become fast friends with the foster's personal cats. Samantha is ready for her furever home, where she can live safely indoors. Email allaboutanimalsaz@gmail.com if you'd like to know more! Est. DOB 7/22/2020. Adoption Fee: $80.December 15, 2022, 9:54 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Samantha, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Karma
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
This super sweet, affectionate girl is Karma. She loves belly rubs and rolling around in the grass. Karma is a Baladi dog who came to us from Egypt where she lost her legs at the hands of a cruel human being. She has since had both legs properly amputated. She is also incontinent. She has a wheelchair, but moves along perfectly without one. This Egyptian princess is pure love!

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

name: Meggy
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Why did the blind dog cross the road? Because she couldn't see what was on the other side! Ha-ha, get it?! A blind dog can't see! I am SO silly! And I'm blind, but that obviously doesn't hamper my ability to be happy and have fun, I just bump into things sometimes. My playing skills are top notch, almost as good as my snuggling skills! And if you combine those two you'll understand how I'm such a good wrestler with my dog friends. My best friend in the whole wide world is Meeka!  We need to go to a home together. I'm talkative, so you can be sure I'll tell you what I'm thinking! Like how I caught Valley Fever when I was younger and need to take meds for the rest of my life, but nowadays I'm doing amazing! I'm like a little caterpillar who had to work really hard to survive and now I've transformed into this beautiful, strong butterfly who is ready for her own home. If you're ready for a chatty, sassy, and snuggly best friend, contact Mayday to tell them you'd like to adopt the pretty little butterfly!

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org
##654654## If you have any questions or would like to adopt Meggy, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Meeka
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
I love running around and playing tug with my doggie friends. I am sweet, goofy, energetic, and playful. I also love to play tug and fetch balls. I get along with other dogs but dog introductions are required to ensure a perfect fit. My bestie is a little blind pup named Meggy and we love goofing around!  We need to be adopted together. 

I was found as a puppy, abandoned and tied to a dumpster, most likely because I was born with deformed legs. I only walk on three of them but that certainly doesn't slow me down any. I play my heart out and love the world! I have no idea I'm different, I love everything! Ready to meet me so we can start our amazing life together?! Contact Mayday today!

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

name: Wallace
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
I don’t mean to brag, but I’m the total package! I love going for adventures outside and I’m a huge fan of cuddles on the couch. I’ll always be excited when you’re around and can’t wait to follow you around. If you give me your hand, I’ll happily show you the best paw shakes in town! I also graduated from obedience class. Can I sit in your lap and give you a million kisses? I love meeting new people and am slowly getting used to playing with new dog friends too. If you already have dogs in your household, I’ll just need an introduction to make sure we’ll be fast friends. My eyes get a little dry so I need daily drops, but I’ll make it very easy for you to do. Let’s set a date and see how quickly we can make ‘us’ official!

name: Skylar
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Skylar is a 1 year and 3 month old GSD/Husky mix that is currently with a great foster family that has other dogs. He is house trained and uses the doggie door.
He is learning manners slowly but with treats and patience, Skylar is able to learn. He knows “sit” and “wait” especially when being fed. He uses a slow feeder for his meals. Skylar goes on a 2 mile walk every day.
Skylar barks at other dogs while on leash but his foster mom believes this is out of curiosity to meet the dogs. He spends time at the dog park and runs around with no signs of aggression. Because Skylar is part Husky, he is naturally vocal. It’s his way of saying “hey, I want to meet you and play”!
He is a bored chewer so his foster parents provide him with many toys and Nylabones.
Skylar likes to sleep on the couch at night.
He likes being with his foster family and his fur siblings.

We are still getting to know Skylar, if you can give Skylar an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/ 

We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization. It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.

name: Smith
location: All About Animals Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Meow there. My name is Smith. I was born September 2017, I'm neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, dewormed, and ready to go to my forever home. I get along with other cats, do ok with dogs, and love people. I’m an affectionate guy, but not pushy.  An ideal day for me is waking up nice and warm and snuggly next to a human, taking a nice long stretch and then hopping out of the bed to see what’s happening around the house. Then it’s a stop at the food dish for some dry food for breakfast and a little snooze in a sunny spot. Then it’s time to get up and play. I like wand toys, crinkle tunnels, and laser lights. By afternoon it’s time for napping again. I think my favorite part of the day is evening, watching tv with a human. I don’t really care what show is on, I just love to curl up in a nice warm lap and enjoy some pet and purr time. I’m really looking forward to finding my forever home, and I hope you’ll consider me.  This is an AAA-Choo kitty that has sneezes and wheezes that do not clear up with antibiotics.  This does not make the cat any less loveable so we adopt them out with a box of tissues!  Adoption fee is $30.December 15, 2022, 9:54 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Smith, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Cowboy
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Cowboy story is like so many these days. A friend asked a family to watched they dog for the night. He would be back for him after work. Well the owner never come back. When the family finally after a couple days got in touch with the passed owner. They explained that they could no longer care for Cowboy and if they need to take him to the shelter. The family reached out to Saving Paws Rescue. We were able to help. Cowboy was good with they small dog, but he still needs to be test with our dogs. Cowboy was good with the owner kids in the home. We are told he is a great boy. From what we can see he is. Now he is just trying to find his family that will never give up on him again.


If you can give Cowboy an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/

name: Chester
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
If you want a protective, affectionate, smart, loyal, athletic 3 year old Belgian Malinois, then look no further, that’s me, Chester! This isn’t my first rodeo so I am looking for commitment, someone in it for the long haul. I require you to be a strong person with a soft heart. I need to look to you for comfort and security when I am feeling a bit unsure of myself. I like other girl dogs and maybe another boy if you can take it slow and introduce us properly. I haven’t met any other creatures, but I promise I’ll try to be nice.  I will be your true best friend, so come on down and meet me!

 As with all Malinios he will need daily mental and physical stimulation. He might do well with another dog if properly introduced. He does want to be the alpha of the pack, so it will need to be a stable well balanced dog to make it work. He has been working with Zen training and is doing very well there. Continued training is always helpful for the dog and the new adopter. 

*****Belgian Malinois Adoption requirements*****

The dog you have selected is a Belgian Malinois.  This is a breed that has very specific needs for an adoptive home.  Because of their need for a high level of exercise, both mentally and physically and their need for ongoing training, only applicants with demonstrated owner/handler experience with this breed will be considered.  The vast majority of them are not best suited as family pets, but in homes with experienced handlers knowledgeable of their needs and breed characteristics.  We will not place in homes with small children or small dogs/cats.  

If you can give Chester  an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/  

 We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization.  It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.

Thank you for your interest in saving a life! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Chester, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Stella
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Stella - Stella was an owner surrender from Wittman after she lost her best friend. She was so stressed after his passing. She had injured her back paw. The rescue been working hard to save her back paw and her owners couldn’t afford to pay for her medical expenses. Saving Paws rescued Stella and got her the medical attention she needed. The vet was able to save her paw and she received daily cleansing and bandage changes. Throughout her recovery, Stella remained very patient.  Her paw has mended and she now wears a protective boot when outside.
Stella is loving, sweet and welcomes attention from all the volunteers. She loves for you to sit with her and cuddle. She would probably be best in a home without other dogs or cats.
If you can give Stella an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website.

name: Blake Lively
location: SHELTER FOR OUTCASTS, UNUSUALS, AND THE LOST AN ANIMAL RESCUE (SOUL) City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Have you ever wanted to meet Blake Lively?   Well let me give you the chance to add her to your family! This sweet girl can hardly sit still she wants to love you so much     Does Blake Lively like other animals?   She has thrived amongst the foster's clan of foster cats/kittens and her energetic lab     Will Blake Lively love you even though she's a celebrity?   Of course she will, if anything she'll love you more because you'll be family to her!     Does she need to be spayed?  No! She comes spayed, microchipped, and vaccinated.    Will I be starstruck by how beautiful she is in real life?  I'll be honest she's incredibly stunning and her fur is very silky, but it's not intimidating!    Don't hesitate to email info@soulanimalshelter.org to meet this sweet girl! Set up a meet and greet with her! You won't want to miss this chance to meet a star!    She is 6 months going on 7 months as of 11/2022.    Plus if you happen to be looking for two awesome cats to join the family, also check out her brother Ryan Reynolds! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Blake Lively, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Babes
location: SHELTER FOR OUTCASTS, UNUSUALS, AND THE LOST AN ANIMAL RESCUE (SOUL) City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Babes had a bit of a rough start to life - he came to us after a community member found him outside and limping on one of his hind legs. He was found to have some bruising from suspected trauma, but that is long in the past now. He has been with us for awhile now and proven himself to be a sweet quirky fella. He has also let us know that he would like to be the only cat in the home - that way he gets all the attention. SIice he has been with the community member and in our foster care program, he has shown himself to be very playful and cuddly with people as long as no other cats around as he really doesn't like other cats! He is even perfect for all his vet visits!   He would prefer to be the only pet in the home, or at least no other cats. Dogs may be okay - he has gotten along with some previously.  He is neutered, up to date on vaccines, and microchipped.  Email us at Info@SoulAnimalShelter.org to set up a meet and greet! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Babes, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story: Need to upgrade your house? Why not start in the kitchen! Hi, I'm Toaster! I was found all alone and without any of my family - but not to worry, I found some brothers and sisters along the way. I am a bit more reserved than the rest of them, but when it comes time for chin scratches and freshly laundered blankets, I like to be where it's at. I'm definitely a people cat, and can't wait to have someone to cuddle all day long, especially once I get to know you. I get along well with cats and dogs, and would love a new family to call my own. Might that be you? name: Mike Meowsky
location: SHELTER FOR OUTCASTS, UNUSUALS, AND THE LOST AN ANIMAL RESCUE (SOUL) City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Hi! My name is Mike Meowski, but my mommies call me Mr. Meowski. If you want a one of a kind cat that acts much like an excited puppy, I'm your guy! I am so social and actually hate being alone (though I tolerate it like a good boy and use at as my nap time). I will greet you when you get home and proceed go run around with the zoomies before returning to hug you and play. I love to play with my toys and like to play tug a war and tag! I also like to play a bit rough, but I'm learning that my teeth are sharp and it hurts my mommies - I am working on my manners. I love to stalk anything that's moving, as I am a curious cat. If you wanna be my new bestie, please email and we will set up a play date :) I love watching dogs in the house and would likely do well with your cat-friendly dogs with a slow intro, and I am working on my cat social skills!    He is estimated to be 4 months old (as of 12/2022) and is:  -Neutered  -Microchipped   -Vaccinated (FVRCP and Rabies)  -Dewormed   -Come with a lifetime supply of love    Please email info@soulanimalshelter.org if interested in adopting! name: Mickey
location: North Phoenix Animal Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
IMPORTANT!! Due to time and staffing constraints, ALL inquiries/questions MUST BE accompanied by your completed Adoption Application (Matchmaking Questionnaire). See above for the link to the form. 
Or email directly to CNPSrescue@gmail.com 
Any inquiries/questions sent without the completed form will NOT receive a response. Thank You for understanding.
Mickey is a handsome 4 y/o 9 lbs brown/tan Cairn Terrier/Chihuahua mix
His adoption fee of $175 includes his neuter, shots and microchip
He may be little shy at first but, look out, once comfortable he'll never deny affection or sitting on your lap. He loves attention.
If he could talk he'd most likely say he'd like a home where he is the king of the castle so he gets all of the attention but he would consider sharing his human with the right furry sibbling on the smaller size and preferably a female. He tends to je scared of big dogs.
Mickey loves to sleep with you and follow you around as you do your daily chores. 
He has not been around cats or young children. Older kids ok. He uses the doggie door and likes to spend some time outside basking in the sunshine and exploring around the back yard. Mickey likes to make a pile out of his treats and toys, and store them on his favorite pillow. He is a charming little guy who provides a lot of entertainment and companionship. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mickey, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Ginger
location: North Phoenix Animal Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
IMPORTANT!!  Due to time and staffing constraints, ALL inquiries/questions MUST BE accompanied by your completed Adoption Application (Matchmaking Questionnaire).  See above for the link to the form.  Any inquiries/questions sent without the completed form will NOT receive a response.  Thank You for understanding.
Affectionate "special needs" Ginger is 4 years old and in search of a loving home that is as special as she is.   Ginger had a rough start in life and for the first year of her puppyhood she was strictly confined in a tiny crate with only a few potty breaks.  As a result, she suffers from claustrophobia and is terrified of leashes.   Despite all this, Ginger is a loving and friendly girl who likes nothing better than to jump up on your lap for a tummy rub, or sit beside you on the couch watching TV.   She also loves sleeping in bed with you.  She likes toys and chew bones and running around out in the back yard.

Ginger is good with other pets and us perfectly potty trained.   She  uses the doggie door and never makes a mess.  Ginger would be the ideal companion for someone who doesn't take their dog for a walk and just wants a friendly and loving pet to be their best friend. 

Her adoption fee is $125 and includes her spay and all shots. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Ginger, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Coconut
location: ABC Animals Benefit Club of AZ City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
When Coconut was rescued from the streets, she was dirty, hungry, and as round as, well…a coconut! Soon after she arrived at ABC she gave birth to four kittens, then adopted FIVE MORE abandoned newborn kittens! Needless to say, she was one busy mama taking care of these babies – Mango, Strawberry, Papaya, Cobbler, Peppermint, Kiwi, Cherry, Peaches, and Sherbet. All the kittens have been adopted and Coconut is ready for her furever home. Coconut likes attention and is playful when she feels like it. When she doesn’t want to be touched, she will let you know with a hiss as a warning... however, she has never followed thru with that warning! She would really like to be the only queen of her castle, but she can co-exist with another cat who will give her space. She needs a home without small children because sometimes she just wants to be left alone. However, she knows her audience and is very gentle with older kids who can see when she is done interacting. This quirky gal makes us laugh with her antics because she really is a sweet cat! Coconut is a hero for all the kittens that she saved. She deserves a home where she can be the queen.

name: Nugget
location: ABC Animals Benefit Club of AZ City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Need a little cat therapy? Nugget’s favorite place to be is in someone’s lap! We believe he’d like to be the only cat so he doesn’t have to compete for lap space, but dogs, vacuums, etc. don’t seem to bother him. This sweet boy really is the most extraordinary cat. He was found waiting for food in a feral cat community. He was so friendly and outgoing he walked right up to the caretaker, who then rescued him. Despite the severe, painful inflammation of his mouth and gums, which resulted in the removal of all of his teeth, his sweet personality never wavered, not even when he was given his pain meds! Nugget also had extensive ear infections when he was rescued. He’s all healed, but when he goes in for an annual well check at the vet, he will need his ears cleaned. This, plus a daily medication for gum inflammation is the extent of his special needs. This calm, loving, purring machine has a heart of gold and is instantly everyone’s best friend. If your home and lap is available, he’d be happy to keep you company!

name: Curry
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Curry is a beautiful, healthy young puppy who we believe is a mix of Labrador and Shepherd and may have small amount of a few other breeds as well. He is approximately 5 months old and was rescued with his mother and siblings from a field on the outskirts of the city. He certainly would not have survived had he not been rescued. Curry is rambunctious and playful. Like most puppies, Curry will need a lot of training and of course, house training. He is already going out of the dog door though. We know that his mother is about 40 lbs and he is currently 29 lbs. But we do not know who the dad was or if the same dad is the father of all of the puppies (YES, that is possible!) We can only speculate on the size these pups will be and if they will all be similar in size. Curry is neutered and fully vaccinated as well as microchipped. He gets along with everyone he meets and has been great with all of the other dogs.     Curry's adoption fee is $225    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.         If you have any questions or would like to adopt Curry, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story: DJ is a sweet and gentle kitty looking for a new home with his sister, Smudgie. They came to HALO when their previous owner was no longer able to care for them, and now they are seeking a calm and quiet home to spend their days cuddling together. name: Little Bear
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Little Bear is one of our "special needs dogs. He is a charming gem of a boy who will love you with all of his heart. Little Bear was born with a condition similar to Spina Bifida in children. His spine did not form normally and he is missing the last few of his vertebrae including his tail. This condition also affects the muscles in his bowels and bladder. He pees and poops all at once but does not have much control over when he does it. In a home he could be put on a schedule to make them more regular and predictable. He has some deficits in his hind legs affecting their conformation and use. He can walk and run but not quite as gracefully as some dogs. Little Bear would love a home with a patient caring adopter. He would benefit from a big yard as well for exercise.     Little Bear's adoption fee is $175.00    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee. name: Mo
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Mo is a handsome and more timid/shy guy looking for his furever home, along with his pal, Mitts. In HALO's care. Mo has displayed behaviors of under socialism and will hide if given the opportunity. As a result of this, HALO has decided that Mo will best thrive in a home where children are 12 years and older. When going to a new home, Mo should be set up in a spare bedroom/bathroom for the first few days of acclimation until he feels more comfortable to explore further. Helping Mo to become more confident and comfortable will look like giving him light head scratches and soft talking to him. Offering him various forms of treats can also help to create a trusting bond. Mo has not had exposure to other animals other than the time he has spent in HALO's care. He will need to be slowly introduced to any resident pets in the home. If Mo is the right fit for you, come meet him at HALO Animal Rescue today!*I am bonded to my friend Mitts and we must go home together* If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mo, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: Shrek
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: I'm Shrek and I'm looking for a swamp I can call home. I'm pretty much your typical ogre- I mean kitten- in the sense that I'm independent, curious, and (once comfortable) I only operate at two speeds; snuggles and mach speed parkour adventures. I'm loyal, loving, and ready to run laps around my new digs. It may take me a bit of time to readjust to my new surroundings and friends, but I'm sure to keep you on your toes with lots of fun and love for the next 15+ years. I like strings, feathers, crinkleys, wands, and pretty much anything that is even mildly entertaining to young kits like me- maybe even crumbled paper balls and water bottle caps, I'm sure to take those down as if they look like Lord Farquaad himself. I have been around other furry friends before (well not any dragons or donkeys, but kitties and doggos) and enjoyed their company, but please introduce me slowly and under supervision to any friends in my new home to ensure we have every chance to get off on the right paw. If you have the time, patience, and love to take on a rambunctious, lovable boy like myself, then come down to meet me today! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Shrek, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Mitts
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Mitts is a sweet loving purring machine who is in search for her new forever home along with her pal, Mo. Mitts can be timid and shy at first, because of this, HALO has decided that Mitts will thrive best in a home where children are 12 years and older. Mitts will need some time to acclimate to her new home at first. name: Jezebel
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: With this much adorableness, there is no need to choose - we are both sure winners! Hi, I'm Jezebel,  and I go home with my sister Dixie. So we will want to be adopted together as a bonded pair! Just think of it: adorableness and love X 2! We do tend to be on the shy side, so we will thrive best in a quiet home! Starting out in a small, enclosed space (i.e. bathroom, pop-up crate, etc) where I will be easily interacted with until acclimated to the home. I should be slowly introduced to any resident pets to reduce stress. It may take weeks (to months if necessary) to acclimate. Positive encouragement during interactions (small amounts of wet food, treats, pets, etc.) is recommended to make positive associations. While we wish every home could be perfect for us... we need a special someone who's willing to be patient and spend quality time with us without expectations for a kitty that spends the day in their lap. We'll gladly cuddle and snuggle, and maybe one day even offer kisses to you once we're warmed up, but just know it might take a little work, and we are willing to try!*I am bonded to my friend Dixie, we must go home together* If you have any questions or would like to adopt Jezebel, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: Batgirl

story: Batgirl is a pretty little kitty in search of her forever home. She made her way to HALO from another shelter, which means most of her history is a mystery. She is a sweet, shy girl who will need a family that's ready to give her the time and patience she needs to come out of her shell. She is nervous when meeting new people, but with time and lots of little sniffs, she will begin to warm up and welcome gentle pettings. She would do best in a calm, low-traffic home. HALO does not know if Batgirl has ever lived in a house before, so it is recommended she is set up in a smaller space when she first goes home (I.e., a bathroom, spare bedroom, etc.) where she can begin to adjust to her surroundings without being overwhelmed by a whole house/apartment to explore. Since HALO does not know if she's been around other cats or dogs, she should be slowly introduced to them once she is feeling more confident in herself and her surroundings. Once she has time to bond with the humans in the home and begins feeling more comfortable in her new space, she can venture out and explore the rest of her new home. With a little TLC and some yummy treats, Batgirl's sweet and soft-spoken personality is sure to blossom. If she sounds like she might be the purr-fect kitty for you, come on down and meet her today! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Batgirl, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Nirvana
location: Suncatcher Sanctuary City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Special Needs: Cerebellar hypoplasia, deaf
Personality: Playful, friendly, needs training

Nirvana was found on the streets of Kuwait as a stray with a gash on his back and Kuwait Animal Aid took him in. His back has fully healed but they also noticed that he has a mild case of Cerebellar Hypoplasia and is completely deaf. Despite his disabilities, he is capable of doing everything on his own without assistance. He is perfectly potty trained! Nirvana has a BIG personality and has the energy of a puppy. His favorite toy is a giant stuffed animal. He is playful, comical, and best of all- cuddly. Because of his high activity level, he may do best in a household as an only cat or with dogs, and with children over 12 years old. story: Hope really lives true to her name. She was found on the streets of Kuwait, paralyzed, most likely after being hit by a car. She was transported to Chicago and then a cat cafe in Milwaukee. After spending about a month at the cat cafe. she was deemed too much for them to handle a paralyzed cat and was transported to us. Hope was given a few chances to live her best life and now we are in search of the right family to give her a loving forever home. Because she is incontinent, she would require manual bladder expression 3~4 times a day. We will be happy to teach you how to express cats. Once you get the hang of it, it becomes second nature.Hope is sweet, cuddly, and loves people. However, she would prefer to keep all of that attention to herself.  Will you give Hope a chance? name: Cookie
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Cookie is an adorable itty bitty Yorkie mixed girl who is extremely loving and devoted to her person. She is under 2 years old and weighs 5 lbs. She is timid upon first meeting but not a biter and warms up and will be a best friend forever. She is learning about leashes and loves riding in the car. She was given up by her owner with her sister because the owner was being evicted. She is an easy keeper and doesn't require much in the way of grooming. She gets along with other dogs well. She is crate trained and also house trained. She can be adopted without or with her sister, if available still.     Cookie's adoption fee is $350    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, spaying or neutering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.     If you have any questions or would like to adopt Cookie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Lindi
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Lindi is a sweet, gentle, endearing girl who we believe is likely a mix of Beagle and Shepherd. She is estimated to be 4-5 years old. She weighs 43 lbs and is a perfect family dog. She's house trained and generally well behaved indoors. She was found in a field with a litter of puppies and she and her pups had little chance of survival had they not been rescued. Lindi gets along with other dogs very well. She is timid with people upon first meeting but is becoming more social every day. Lindi would love to have a nice yard to roll in the grass and to romp and play in. She is a very easy dog and has no behavior problems to speak of.     Lindy will require regular brushing, as well as nail trims     Lindi's adoption fee is $175    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, spaying or neutering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.     If you have any questions or would like to adopt Lindi, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Toby
location: The Barn House AZ City: Peoria, AZ
story:
It was said when he came in as a singleton that he fell from an attic. He was very sick and in the process of treatment when he was diagnosed as ringworm positive. Lucky for us that meant he could join us at The Barn House/ Help With Cats program. THe is all healthy now!
oby has a cute little kink at the tip of his tail. He is very affectionate but also playful with his kitten friends. It is highly recommended that he has someone to play with and get his kitten energy out but of course, he will love any affectionate home he can get. Just make sure you are ready for all of his love. Someone special will be blessed with his presence. Come and see him soon to claim him as your own. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Toby, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Gidget
location: The Barn House AZ City: Peoria, AZ
story: Gidget.. “The one eyed pirate” This sweet girl has a special story. She was in a very large colony that was out of control with kittens. A woman in her 70’s determined to take matters into her own hands in the midst of a shortage of help and resources. She was willing and able to be taught to trap herself. After getting a few short lessons on trapping she proceeded to trap her entire colony of over 25 cats. The Barn House recovered all of them and held 15 of those kittens for continued acclimation and assessment. This special girl had the worst of an eye infection and it went downhill quickly regardless of consistent treatment. She was taken to the ER but the bill was too much for us to handle. Luckily the Barn House special vet came to the rescue and got her in quickly for eye enucleation saving us from having to say goodbye to her in her pain. It was still an investment but well worth it. We were worried she would be bullied ...but she now has the nickname of the one-eyed pirate. She is getting along fine with her kitten friends but would be completely okay being the only kitten to love in the house. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Gidget, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story:
Ecco!! “Uncle Ecco” 
A BH community Fave..and a favorite among the kittens in the guest house hence the name. This sweet boy was on the euthanasia list for ringworm and a needed dental. Fully recovered through our Help With Cats facility and 7 Extractions later and he is ready to be the best decision you made. He will always be found keeping the peace between sassy kittens, cuddling them tenderly, or playing with them gently. This boy LOVES his babies. There will be a few tears shed when this guy leaves the open adoption cat house from kittens and volunteers alike. This boy would be you are a kitten foster home or have companionship for him. name: Tres
location: Help a Dog Smile City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Reminder: This is a young dog! Please remember a 15 year lifespan! Tres is an  active little guy....yes he will snuggle on your lap but he  also runs and plays and jumps...yes that means on chairs to get to your table!  Tres is  small and cuddly but if he gets scared he will defend himself which means young children under 10 who move fast and are not able to determine when the dog is scared are probably not a good fit! Tres does take time to warm up to people so a home with fewer people is better.., but no fears once he knows you are his person a lap dog he will be.          Meet Tres, a 2 y/o 8-pound terrier mix.     Tres will do great in a home with a small playful female dog.       Tres still has a bit of puppy in him so keeping him entertained with toys and attention is a bonus.  Tres also loves attention and when done exploring he would love to be held and cuddled.  Tres is part clown and part love and really cute.  In the morning he likes exploring and would enjoy being leashed trained so he could take walks.  Tres is house-trained at his foster home with a dog door but could need a refresher course when placed in his forever home with a new routine.          If you are looking for a little dog to keep your lap warm and heart full, please complete an adoption application. He is up to date on shots and neutered and micro chipped.             Tres’s adoption fee of $350 will help with medical needs of the rescue group.  If you are interested in  Tres, and live in the Phoenix metro area,  please fill out an application* at:          https://helpadogsmile.org/adoption-application/       and a volunteer will contact you to see if Tres is a good fit for your home.                   *Please note that the application is not a commitment to adopt–it is a tool used to help determine if a dog and applicant would make a good match. Applications are forwarded to the foster family for review and follow-up.           December 14, 2022, 12:35 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Tres, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Mitt
location: ForeverFelines/Fidos - Phoenix Area City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hi, my name is Mitt. I’m a 5 month old little boy with the cutest white mittens (hence the name 😊). My mom was found living outdoors and very pregnant. I’m one of her 6 kittens! A  kind lady helped my mom and now we’re all healthy, happy,  and super friendly! I’m a wonderful boy. My siblings and I still need to find families of our own though. Being a kitten, I love to play with toys, my siblings and the other foster kittens and cats and of course I love to be petted and sit on your lap (my fur is so soft, it's like silk). When I want your attention, I'll come look for you and ask for a pet. I'll also sleep with you at night. I like playing with kids and adults – I really am a great kitten. 

I’m all ready for my new forever home because I’m neutered, I’ve had my vaccines including rabies, I’ve been dewormed AND I’ve been chipped. Whew, I’m all set to go to my forever family. I’m still very young and I’ll be lonely being an only kitty so my favorite would be to find a home with another young kitty or you could adopt one of my siblings! I could love one person or a whole family of people - I'm not picky. I don’t know if I’ve been around dogs but being so young, I'll probably be fine if the dog is friendly to kitties. If you’d like to have a sweet, handsome, playful addition to your family, I’m your guy. I’ll be waiting to hear from you!  

P.S. This is an adorable kitten that needs and deserves a loving family home. So, if you are willing and able to adopt this striking and sweet boy, please email drtweets2@msn.com or call/text 602-757-9791 and ask for Deb. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mitt, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Yule
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
YULE-tide greetings, from... Yule! Yule is a two-year-old Tabby mix. Not too much is known of his past life prior to coming to Home Fur Good. He was rescued from the Maricopa County shelter after being turned in as a stray. If Yule could talk, we are sure he would have lots of stories to tell about his time on the streets. For now though, Yule is happy to be safe and indoors. He is a friendly guy who allowed all handling for his photo shoot, and leaned into our pets. We are looking forward to getting to know Yule better in the coming days. If you would like to visit him in the meantime, call 602-971-1334 for an adoption appointment!

Yule is listed at two years old and his adoption fee is $85. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. name: Marmalade
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Marmalade is a petite little lady, weighing just seven pounds.  She was found as a stray and a Good Samaritan took her in.  While the hunt was on to find her owners, it was discovered Marmalade was pregnant.  Home Fur Good stepped in and was able to find her a foster home, where she had and raised her kittens.  Marmalade not only raised her own litter, she also took in an orphan and raised her too.  Marmalade is a bit of a shy lady. She tends to hang out in her hidey holes in the free-roam cat room, while she watches all the goings-on. 

Marmalade is three years old and ready to be a pampered princess in her own forever home.  If you're looking for a petite and pretty kitty, call 602-971-1334 to meet Marmalade.

Marmalade's adoption fee is $100. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. Home Fur Good Animal Rescue is located at 10220 North 32nd Street, just south of Shea Blvd in Phoenix. name: Canta
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Canta came to the shelter with another cat when their former owner had to move into hospice care. Unfortunately, her feline friend was very sick, and passed away, despite extensive vet care. :-( It's clear Canta was well loved throughout her life. Her brother was the more outgoing of the two and would check things out for Canta. Canta is adjusting to her new life at the shelter, without her trusty sidekick. Canta is a bit reserved and will find a safe spot to watch all the goings-on. She is mellow, friendly, and readily accepted pets almost as soon as she met us. We would love to find Canta a safe and patient home, after all she's been through. 

Canta recently went into a foster home, which means all of your questions about her behavior in a home can be answered! If you're looking to help a special senior, call 602-971-1334 to Canta.

Canta is listed at 11 years old. Her adoption fee is $50. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. name: Minerva

story:

They do not have to be adopted together, but they do get along, if you're looking for a feline duo. Minerva isn't a shy lady. She immediately came forward for pets and attention. When we picked her up for her photo shoot though, her tune changed a bit. Minerva prefers to explore on her own, not be carried by a human, thanks very much. ;-) Minerva was temporarily being watched by a friend of her former owner and they report she is the more "outgoing and playful" of the two cats. 

Minerva is currently hanging out at the PetsMart at Tatum & Shea Blvd., Phx. You can visit her during business hours, and call 602-971-1334 for an adoption appointment.

name: Antonio
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ
story: Hello, my name is Antonio! I am a 10 week old Bengal & Tabby mix boy! I am so handsome with my racy spots and my big green eyes really turn heads! I am very cuddly and I purr with delight! I am also quite athletic and I love to play all kitten sports! CHECK OUT MY VIDEO! I am specifically seeking a home where I can have a young and playful kitty buddy for lots of fun times! If you don't have a kitty a home, I have a brother named Giovanni and 4 other kitten friends!  My $95 adoption fee includes vet check, neuter, vaccinations, negative feline leukemia test, microchip, my vet records and lots of new toys! Adopt my brother Giovanni or one of my friends as my Purrfect Pair for half off of the second adoption fee! If you can give me a lifetime home where I can have a young and playful kitty buddy and if you have a solid cat history including a veterinarian, please email live.love.meow@gmail.com directly for a matchmaking questionnaire! name: Kelly
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Are you looking for an outgoing cat with long, luxurious locks? Meet Kelly! Kelly was brought to the shelter along with two other cats (Princess and George) when their former owner moved. They don't have to be adopted together, and in fact, we think Kelly wouldn't mind being the only queen in her new home. Kelly isn't shy in the least. She immediately approached us for pets and attention upon our first meeting. She hopped out of her kennel and started exploring the room. Kelly enjoys head scratches and pets on her beautiful fur. She will settle in and cozy up for lap time if you sit down. Kelly's coat will require some time and attention to those beautiful long locks, but we don't think she will mind being pampered and beautified.

Kelly is currently hanging out at the PetsMart at Tatum & Shea Blvd., Phx. You can visit her during business hours and call 602-971-1334 for an adoption appointment.

Kelly is listed at 10 years old. Her adoption fee is $85. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. Home Fur Good Animal Rescue is located at 10220 North 32nd Street, just south of Shea Blvd in Phoenix. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Kelly, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Violet Skye
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ
story: Hello, my name is Violet Skye! I am a 1 year old Tuxedo girl! I am so stunning with my big copper eyes, my striking white whiskers and my stylish goatee! I am very affectionate, I love to get cuddles and to sleep on the bed, and I am very soothing and supportive when you need it most! I am quite grateful for everything and promise my endless devotion and love! If you are searching for a super sweet companion who is low maintenance and well mannered, with lots of purrs on top, here I am! I get along well with other cats, too! CHECK OUT  MY VIDEO! ** I am the Cat of the Month! My special $35 adoption fee includes everything you need to get started: vet check, spay, vaccinations, negative feline leukemia test, microchip, my vet records, food, new litter box, litter, and new cat tree! ** If you can provide a lifetime home, and if you also have a solid cat history including a veterinarian, please email live.love.meow@gmail.com directly for a matchmaking questionnaire! name: Mew
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Meet Mew! Mew was rescued by Home Fur Good from the county shelter. She was an owner surrender; the owner stated, "have to surrender, can only have two cats in the home". Mew's owner reported that she is a shy cat in the home setting and enjoyed her hidey-holes. Mew would possibly prefer a quiet and calm environment where she can get comfortable and used to her new surroundings. At Home Fur Good, Mew was friendly as soon as we met her and even made some paw biscuits while we were petting her. She is a stunning looking cat, with her pretty orange highlight "Torbie" coat and bright green eyes.

Come meet Mew for yourself by calling 602-971-1334 for an appointment!

Mew is listed at three years old and weighs approximately 10 pounds. Her adoption fee is $85. I am a super sweetie and I have such a soothing purr when I am cuddled! I am a bit on the shy side at first and in need of someone who will help me to acclimate with lots of snuggles.  I love to play and I am quite adept at kitten soccer! I am specifically seeking a home where I can have a fun kitty buddy! If you don't have one at home, my brother Antonio is available and I also have 4 other friends! name: Sphinx
location: ForeverFelines/Fidos - Phoenix Area City: Glendale, AZ
story:
I’m Sphinx. I’m a beautiful and unusual calico Siamese mix. Calico kitties come in many, many breeds because calico is just a color. I am a cool and exotic girl! I have those long, big ears, big eyes and the slim face and body of the Siamese. My foster mom looked it up and it must have been my dad who was Siamese to make me a calico in a Siamese body (well according to Wikipedia anyway) 😊. I’m very young, maybe around 1.5 yrs or so the vet said. I was found wandering a city park - hungry, dirty, and lonely. Now I’m all clean, my belly is full, and I follow my foster mom around the house talking to her, telling her all about my adventures in the park and about how happy I am being safe and indoors. 

I’m very friendly and love to be on my foster mom’s lap to snuggle. When I’m on her lap I tend to knead a lot and talk a lot (that's the Siamese in me) – I’m super happy to be with a person again. I follow her around so I can get any extra pets and to just see what’s going on. I’m very curious about what’s happening and I’m very energetic and athletic – after all I am still a young girl.  I've learned to get along with the other foster kitties but I'd prefer to be an only cat and only pet 😊. My perfect forever home would have people who’ll love me lots, who will play with me a lot.

I’m already spayed so I’m ready to go to my forever family right now! Do you think you could give this remarkably distinctive cat (that’s me!) another chance at love and a family? I’m sure I’d be a fun, beautiful and loving addition and it would be my dream come true to find a forever home with you. You can call or text me at 602-757-9791 and ask for Deb. Or email me at drtweets2@msn.com    I’ll be waiting to hear from you! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Sphinx, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Nanny
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Before you see Nanny, you'll likely HEAR her. Nanny has one of the loudest purr-motors we've ever encountered. When you locate the source of the loud purrs, you'll see Nanny rubbing her head against the kennel bars and trying to get your attention. Nanny loves affection and was happy for any and all pets we gave her. She happily hung out in our lap for her photo shoot, soaking up all the love and attention we could spare. Nanny was surrendered to the shelter with another cat because they were getting into fights near the litter box. Perhaps Nanny would like to have her own private toilet? ;-) In the free-roam cat room, Nanny does well with the other cats. She will follow you around the room to see what you're up to, and ask for attention.

You can meet Nanny by calling 602-971-1334 for an adoption appointment. 

Nanny is a gorgeous dilute Tortie, listed at five years old. Her adoption fee is $100. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. Home Fur Good Animal Rescue is located at 10220 North 32nd Street, just south of Shea Blvd in Phoenix. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Nanny, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Shadow
location: ForeverFelines/Fidos - Phoenix Area City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hello there, I’m Shadow. Are you a black cat aficionado?? Well then, you need to meet me.  I’m a beautiful 4-month-old black “ghost or shadow” tabby. I’m the kind of tabby where my outer coat is solid black, and my tabby markings are in my inner coat. You can see those faint tabby markings in the right light. So if you like black cats that  are super cool, that’s me 😉 Did you know black cats are considered lucky in many places in the world? So far in my life I’ve been very very, lucky. My mom was rescued a few weeks before I and my siblings were born so we had the great luck of being born into a family with people big and little. We’re now the sweetest & friendliest kittens you’d ever want to meet. How lucky! And you and I will be very lucky when we find each other!  

I’m a very friendly kitten. I play with the other kitties at my foster home and with the humans too – both big (adults) and little (kids). I’ll sleep on your bed, your lap and by your side but I'm also independent and can entertain myself too. I’m always up for petting and snuggling. And I’ve never met a cat toy or cat-tree I didn’t like!  

I’m all ready for my new forever home because I’m spayed, I’ve had my vaccines including rabies, I’ve been dewormed AND I’ve been chipped. Whew, I’m all set to go to my forever family. I’m still very young and I’ll be lonely being an only kitty (especially after having lots of kitties to play with at my foster home) so my favorite would be to find a forever family with another young kitty or you could always adopt me with one of my siblings too! I could love one person or a whole family of people - I'm not picky. I haven’t been around dogs yet but being so young, I'll probably be fine if the dog is friendly to kitties. If you’d like to have a sweet, beautiful, playful addition to your family, I’m your girl. I’ll be waiting to hear from you!  

P.S. This is an adorable kitten that needs and deserves a loving family home. So, if you are willing and able to adopt this striking and sweet girl, please email drtweets2@msn.com or call/text 602-757-9791 and ask for Deb. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Shadow, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Rocky
location: ForeverFelines/Fidos - Phoenix Area City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hi, I’m Rocky. I’m a very cute dark grey and white 7-month-old short haired kitten. The pictures of me don’t quite do me justice because in the sunshine, my fur has beautiful swirls in it. You can just see swirls in my first pictures along with the rings on my tail. Very handsome! I’m a super friendly kitten. I’m always up to loving on someone. I’ll come over and sit by you just in case you have a free hand to pet me.  I really like playing with little kids – what a special kitty I am 😊.  You won’t find a sweeter kitten than me!

My siblings and I were found in a storm drain with our mom by a maintenance crew. We were just about 3 weeks old. It’s a good thing the monsoons hadn’t started yet, or we wouldn’t have made it ☹. A nice lady came to help us and scooped us all up (mom too) to foster us. Now our futures are bright and we’re ready for forever homes.

I am tail up and purring kind of kitten. I’ll follow you around so I can get more attention and I just plain love people (and kitties too). But put a toy in front of me and I’ll play and play. 

I’m all ready for my new forever home because I’m neutered, I’ve had my FVRCP vaccines including rabies, I’ve been dewormed AND I’ve been chipped. Whew! I’m all set to go to my forever family. I’d probably be happiest getting adopted into a home with another chill cat or kitten to play with or with someone who has the time to love on me a lots. I could love one person or a whole family of people - I'm not picky. Because I’m so young still I’ll need a home with another friendly cat or kitten. If you don’t have another cat and are looking for two kittens, my foster ‘siblings’ are looking for good homes too. I haven’t been around dogs but being so young, I'll probably be fine if the dog is friendly to kitties. If you’d like to have a sweet, beautiful, and loving addition to your family, I’m your fellow. I’ll be waiting to hear from you! 

P.S. This is an adorable and affectionate kitten that needs and deserves a loving family home. So, if you are willing and able to adopt this handsome boy, please email drtweets2@msn.com or call/text 602-757-9791 and ask for Deb. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Rocky, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Snorlax
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Eight-year-old Snorlax is one of our special needs cats who could really use a quiet and patient home environment. Snorlax was rescued from the county shelter, at risk for euthanasia and marked as "new hope" (rescue) only. He was surrendered to the shelter by his former owner, and the transition has been hard for this senior kitty. Snorlax is a go-slow kinda guy and so far has not invited us to have too many interactions with him. We are sure this will change once Snorlax feels safe and loved in a home environment. In the meantime, we will do our best to get to know Snorlax and help him feel secure with the routines at Home Fur Good. Snorlax has decreased kidney function and will require a renal food only diet. 

Snorlax recently went into a foster home, which means all of your questions about his behavior in a home can be answered! If you are looking to help a special senior cat, please call 602-971-1334 to meet Snorlax.

Snorlax is listed at eight years old and weighs approximately six pounds. His adoption fee is $50. All Home Fur Good cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped, dewormed, vaccinated appropriate for their age, tested for FIV/FELV and vet checked. Home Fur Good Animal Rescue is located at 10220 North 32nd Street, just south of Shea Blvd in Phoenix. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Snorlax, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Remy

story:
Meet Remy! This kitty is not only handsome, but smart! Remy was roaming the streets as a stray when he decided to park himself on the porch of a Home Fur Good employee. We imagine Remy knew what he was doing. ;-) He was scanned for a chip and an owner was searched for, but to no avail. Now, Remy finds himself off the streets and safe at rescue... and ready for adoption! Remy would love an indoor home with all the comforts a cat could desire. Soft beds, lap time, treats, and lots of love. Remy is a bit shy at first and will hang in the back of his kennel to check things out. He readily accepts pets and allowed all handling during his photo shoot. We don't know what this guy's past was, but we do know his future looks bright indeed!

Remy is currently hanging out at the PetsMart at Tatum & Shea Blvd. in Phoenix. You can visit him during business hours, and call 602-971-1334 for an adoption appointment with Home Fur Good.

Remy is listed at approximately three years old and his adoption fee is $85. name: SERENA
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Serena is a smooshie-faced glamour-puss! Home Fur Good could not resist this cutie-patootie that they spotted at the county shelter. Serena will turn six years old in September 2022.  She is a 58-pound Pit Bull and Shar-Pei mix.  (Serena arrived at HFG at 67 pounds, with walks, playtime, jogs on RunBuddy and consistent diet, Serena got her girly figure back).  Serena has now spent an entire year in the shelter system.  She arrived at county in September 2021 and then came to Home Fur Good in December 2021.  Granted, Serena was a bit of a hot mess, a cute one, but still a hot mess.  Along with the weight loss, Serena has gained control of her allergies and no longer does she have patchy fur or open wounds.  She will need a family dedicated to watching what she eats and making sure nothing sneaks in that will cause a flare up.  Serena is curious and outgoing; she happily exits her kennel with anyone at any opportunity. She likes to explore, and she does so without hesitation. We wonder if Serena has selective hearing and prefers to pick and choose whom she listens to, or she may have legit hearing loss. Serena is a total sucker for a squeaky toy and she will entertain herself for hours with a stuffy baby.  If you are looking for a goofy girl with a bit of an independent streak, give a call to meet to Serena. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. name: BELMONT (COURTESY POST)
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
*PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A COURTESY POST AND BELMONT IS NOT AT HOME FUR GOOD*. FOR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE USE THE CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW. 
It is with sadness that I’m looking for a new, loving home for my beloved dog, Belmont.  He’s 6 years old, weighs approximately 95 pounds, is neutered and up to date on shots.
Belmont is a handsome, friendly, strong Pit Bull mix who enjoys food, treats, walks (moderate pulling on the leash), runs, and especially being chauffeured around town. He likes meeting new people and will be your loyal companion once he gets to know you. He’s past the chewing stage, and doesn’t mind being in a comfy crate for short periods of time.
Belmont is dog-selective and prefers to be the alpha, so he needs to be with someone who does not have other dogs. Cats are probably not a good idea either (he hasn’t lived with cats) as he does have a prey drive.  While walking him, it’s best not to greet other dogs until you are very comfortable with Belmont and can read his signs of agitation.
He would not do well with small children since he is strong and would most likely knock them down with his weight. If you don’t have other pets or small children, please consider Belmont as your new BEST FRIEND.
For more information or to meet Belmont, please email Terry at vecova@sbcglobal.net.  Thank you! If you have any questions or would like to adopt BELMONT (COURTESY POST), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

He rides great in the car, he enjoys going on walks, rolling in the grass, and just hanging out with his people. Dog and kid friendly, unsure about cats, bring the family to meet sweet Bronson, he won't disappoint. He is up to date on his vaccines, neutered, microchipped. name: LADY ROVER & SIR FETCH
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Fetch and Rover arrived at Home Fur Good in September 2021.  They were all prim and proper then, going by Sir Fetch and Lady Rover.  In the past year, all formality has been lost and now that they have endeared themselves, the nicknames are a plenty.  Sometimes there is hesitation on whether dogs are truly “bonded,” Fetch and Rover have proven daily they are besties for life.  Fetch is the most patient of gentle giants and he lets his little buddy rule the roost.  You can see, when Rover is causing a commotion, he will just roll his eyes and let her blow off some steam.  They both ADORE squeaky toys and it is very entertaining to watch them play tug and switch off sharing their stuffies.  Rover is a nine-pound, six-year-old Chihuahua mix and her buddy, Fetch, is a 55-pound, eight-year-old Pit Bull mix.   Fetch and Rover are both very friendly and outgoing dogs.  They are always happy to make a new human friend, and they love getting pets and attention. Fetch and Rover have even been to dog friendly patios.  They will happily follow you around to see what you are up to, and they will make wonderful companion pets.  They both walk well on a leash and love the HFG Walking Club.  Rover’s ears flop in the wind as she bobs along keeping pace with Fetch and his long legs.  Fetch is the lap dog; he will sit and soak up belly rubs all day long.  Rover can be a busy little bee and she loves RunBuddy day at the shelter.  Are you ready to roll out your red carpet for these two? The total adoption fee for both is $350 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt LADY ROVER & SIR FETCH, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: JUNE
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: June is an eight-year-old, 13-pound Chihuahua mix.  She was on the New Hope list at the county shelter.  The New Hope list is for dogs in need of adoption or to be taken in by a rescue ASAP due to various issues.  One of county’s concerns was that she does have a heart murmur and they were unwilling to spay her, for fear of putting her under anesthesia.  Home Fur Good took her in and had her monitored and checked closely by a veterinarian.  June was able to be spayed and she did have a lipoma removed.  A lipoma is a benign (noncancerous) tumor of fat in middle-aged or older dogs.  June will require medication to treat her heart murmur for the rest of her life.  When June first arrived at HFG, she was quite fearful and unsure of her new living situation.  In the past couple of months, she has gained confidence and has started to let her inner puppy out to play.  She shows she can still get zoomies and she has a favorite squeaky giraffe toy that she likes to take and run with.   Routine, time, and gentle actions will help June feel more comfortable in day-to-day activities.  Home Fur Good kennel techs, who work with June consistently, already see her playful side and love to share her story.  You too can see her gentle nature in her video, as she willingly chooses to crawl into a warm lap.  If you have a big heart and a need to win over a pint-size fur baby, call 602-971-1334 to meet June! The adoption fee is $150 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt JUNE, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

However, since coming to Home Fur Good she has not said more than two words at a time.  Faun has really blossomed during her short time at Home Fur Good.
