name: HARPO
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Harpo was on the New Hope List at the county shelter due to his fear and under-socialization.  Harpo is a four-year-old, 14-pound Chihuahua mix.  One tactic with a fearful dog is to show them consistency.  Each day, when faced with the same routine, they begin to expect certain activities, and through these repeated activities they gain confidence because they know what to expect.  Harpo spent a few weeks in the home of Home Fur Good’s Animal Coordinator, if you are interested in Harpo, you will get detailed information on his behavior in a home environment.  Harpo’s foster home contained two small dogs, a large older dog and two cats.  Harpo was immediately friendly with the dogs.  He met the cats a couple of times on leash, and he was interested, tried to run toward them, then he would scare himself and roll over.  It took Harpo about two weeks to become comfortable with both humans in the home and allow himself to be picked up by everyone.  Harpo has a medium energy level. He likes to play with balls and stuffed toys, and he will get pretty wild throwing them around and chasing after them. He did give a little growl if the other dogs approached the toys he was playing with.  Harpo is not leash trained, but he will follow people around the house, and while outside he would follow the other dogs, so they practiced walking around with the leash on and Harpo is slowly gaining confidence.  Harpo slept in a dog crate for the first week then slept in the bedroom with everyone and the other dogs after that. He was quiet in the crate the first night, cried the second night, then was fine. During the day he was crated at first then able to stay loose in the bedroom with the other dogs.  Harpo really enjoyed the yard, he liked running around and barking with the other dogs, exploring, and sunbathing by the pool.  Harpo is working on potty training. He picked up the foster home routine really well and held it while he was crated but there were a couple of accidents at night or right after dinner. Harpo never learned how to use the dog door and he worked on learning to sit by the door when he needed to go out.  Harpo likes to be held although he almost always does a submissive roll when you go to pick him up. He really likes dog beds and cuddling in fluffy blankets.  Harpo is working on “sit.” He learned very fast to sit before getting dinner.  Harpo is taking Trazodone, to help maintain mental balance. Harpo makes your heart melt, and you just want to will him to be happy and let his inner puppy out to play.  He needs a family that will be patient and will give him the time and space he needs to be comfortable and to let his personality shine through.  He would probably enjoy a home with another dog, as he seems to be a social learner. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt HARPO, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: KITTY
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: If Kitty could talk, she would probably have amazing stories to tell!  She is a three-year-old, 53-pound Pit Bull mix.  Kitty was adopted out of the county shelter in March, and then in August she was picked up as a stray and turned back in to county.  Kitty had patches of fur missing and scaly skin.  County made the decision to place Kitty on the euthanasia list.  Home Fur Good met her and fell in love.  Kitty is extremely social and outgoing, and HFG felt that Kitty probably had allergies and allergies can be treated.  HFG was right: Kitty has allergies, and they are to environmental items that will be hard to avoid.  Cotton, wool, grasses, and dust mites are just a few things that trigger her allergies.  HFG put Kitty on a Hydrolyzed Protein Diet and made sure she did not sneak any unauthorized treats.  Her Adoption Packet will contain the extensive results of her allergy test.  She has become the Go-To Girl when it is time to evaluate dogs on their behaviors with other dogs.  Kitty not only loves to make human friends, but she is also almost always open to a new doggie friend.  She loves to wrestle and get down and dirty with her buddies.  Kitty has an interesting bark; she almost mimics a parrot when she is excited.  If you want a social girlfriend, you need to visit Kitty and see if you are instant besties. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt KITTY, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: LUIGI
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Luigi is a growing German Shepherd mix puppy with a birthdate of January 28, 2022.  Luigi might be a bit of an escape artist.  He was found as a stray in August and returned to his owner, and then he was again found as a stray in October.  Luigi does not appear to have been properly socialized.  Lots of pet parents think that the term “puppy socialization” means introducing your puppy to other dogs. But there is a lot more to it than that. In fact, socialization is the process of introducing your puppy to the whole wide world, from different types of people to places and objects they’ve never seen before.  Pet parents should aim to expose their puppy to as many different positive experiences as they can.  Luigi knows to sit when asked, but he does not understand the leash.  He loves to play, but if you move a certain way, he might crouch in fear or react with a sneer.  Luigi is open to learning; he needs an owner with time and patience to show him what is expected of a Good Dog. Luigi aims to please and he really wants to play and have fun with new friends. The adoption fee is $300 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt LUIGI, please reach out to the adoption group directly. story: Johnny is an eleven-year-old, 19-pound Chihuahua mix.  He is one of those older dogs that saunters about, sees activity, and then wanders over to see what is going on, but by the time he gets there the commotion is done.  Then, he will stand there with a quizzical look on his face.  Just a clueless, older dog, going about his business, having no idea that he is making our hearts explode and our faces smile.  Johnny is happy just to be left alone, to check out his surroundings, find a comfy spot and take his 13th nap of the day.  Home Fur Good did take the step of having a lipoma removed from Johnny.  A lipoma is a benign (noncancerous) tumor of fat in middle-aged or older dogs. If you want a lap-warmer, a napping buddy, company to enjoy the sunshine while you have your morning coffee, then Johnny is your man. story: Guinness is a busy little bee that has been on the minds of those at Home Fur Good who make the journey to county to find new residents. Three weeks after the initial meeting, Guinness was still at county searching for his forever home, so HFG brought him in to try and help with that search. He is a four-year-old, 18-pound, highly active Chihuahua mix. Guinness knows that he is handsome, and he asks that you allow him space; he is not one of those dogs that wants to constantly be picked up and snuggled. He is confident in himself, and he does not require all that assurance. With his dash of chihuahua attitude, Guinness will do best in a home with older children.  He has really begun to trust his favorite volunteers, and he will seek affection and glorious head scratches. Guinness loves the game of fetch, he goes batty for squeaky toys, and for now, playing is much more fun than dozing the day away!  Guinness was hooked the moment he was asked to join the Walking Club.  He loves to prance about town and check out all the sights and scenes.  The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt GUINNESS, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: NUTMEG
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Nutmeg was turned in to the county shelter in early February.  While there, she seemed wary of new people, which did not help her on the adoption front.  Nutmeg is a three-year-old, 45-pound Pit Bull and Boxer mix.  She does have a brief moment of shyness but if you have treats or start itching her bum, she will be your bestie, quick as a blink.  She is a total lapdog and wants to soak up as much affection as she can.  If you get goofy, or squeak a toy, she will get all silly and show you her amazing zoomies.  Nutmeg is also a smarty-pants; she knows sit, paw or shake, and we think she knows down.  If Nutmeg goes to a home with children, there should only be older children. Give a call to meet your new girlfriend! The adoption fee for Nutmeg is $300, which is higher than it would be under our normal fee schedule. That is because she is one of our Guardian Angel dogs.  Guardian Angel dogs are highly desirable adoptees, and their increased fees are used expressly to help defray costs for our rescues with special needs such as advanced medical treatment or training for behavioral issues, or for those who are with us for unusually long periods of time.  In this way the Guardian Angels directly help our other rescues!  All adoption fees include spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt NUTMEG, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: BLOSSOM
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Blossom is a natural beauty.  She got those amazing genes that make other girls jealous.  When people lay eyes on Blossom it is always the same comment in amazement: “look at those leg muscles.”  Blossom is a five-year-old Pit Bull Terrier mix, and she is 47 pounds of svelte muscle.  Blossom was turned in at the county shelter in early February.  Blossom had been placed on county’s New Hope list because she tested positive for anaplasmosis, an easily treatable tick-borne illness.  The treatment just requires time for recovery, and county does not have the space to house dogs needing time to get healthy for adoption.  Blossom is very alert and sensitive to her surroundings.  Home Fur Good is working to find the key to her attention, so she is not distracted by all that is going on in the shelter environment.  Blossom has already joined the Dog-Walking Club and she proves she would love it if her workers could go faster and farther.  She is an intelligent girl; she knows sit and paw and would be open to learning more to exercise her brain too.  So far, Blossom is saying she is not ready to make any doggie friends, and that is OK.  HFG will work with her to coexist; she does not have to have dog playmates.  Blossom would excel in an active home with energetic members looking to give her tasks that exercise her body and mind. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt BLOSSOM, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: PETEY
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Petey came to Home Fur Good in November 2021 after being found as a stray.  He was coming up on a full year at HFG, and steps have been taken to help him complete the process to find his forever family.  Getting his stats out there, he will soon be turning three years old, and he is a 53-pound, Boxer mix.  HFG has always known that Petey is a good boy and that he has amazing potential to learn new tricks, skills, and the desired behaviors to become an amazing canine citizen.  Petey has spent two full weeks in Board and Train with George at Couth Canine.  Petey was introduced to heeling and sitting at his handler’s side.  Petey loves going on walks and adventures, and by learning leash manners, his opportunity to go out and about increases tenfold.  Petey thrived with school and having a pack leader.  Petey’s biggest desire is hanging out with people and feeling pets and affection.  He is willing to listen and follow instruction for the sheer joy of a head scratch and hearing “good boy.”    His forever family will need to continue to work with Petey.  A tight bond can be developed with a healthy environment of a strong pack leader and Petey.  Petey is fine making new dog friends.  His preference is for dogs who give him space and prefer co-existing over wrestling.   If you can match Petey’s vibrant attitude, come on down and meet him. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt PETEY, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: BUBBA
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Like a Big Boy?  Bubba is ready to become your new favorite.  Bubba was in the home of a foster for the county shelter.  He had his foster mom wrapped around his paw and she reached out for assistance from Home Fur Good.  Bubba is 80 pounds of love bug.  He was a Velcro dog to his foster mom, and she found that he was lovable and loyal towards all people, both adults and children.  Bubba is a Pit Bull mix, and he is five years old.  He has lived long enough to know he would prefer to be the only pet in his forever home.  His foster mom said that he is housebroken, and he will let you know when he needs something by barking, pacing, or scratching at a barrier.  Otherwise, he rarely barks.  He was left alone for four to five hours at a time with no issue.  Bubba was taken on two walks a day ranging from half a mile to a mile.  When he decides to pull, he will need a strong handler.  Toys with squeakers do not stand a chance around Bubba; he sure does enjoy them.  He also loves belly rubs, car rides, and being involved in all household activities.  In his past, Bubba has had multiple hematomas and ear infections.  His inner right ear is partially collapsed from this.  He does require ear cleaning every two to three days, which he tolerates with treats and affirmations.  If you are ready for a gentle, giant lapdog, call to meet Bubba. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt BUBBA, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: ROOT BEER & SPARKLETTS
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: If you have one loving lap warmer, there can only be one situation to make that better: having two loving lap warmers!  Root Beer and Sparkletts are nine-year-old sisters.  Root Beer is a squishie pudgie who has been described as if you are hugging jelly.  Sparkletts is more fit and trim and a proper prancer.  They are 12 and ten pounds, respectively, perfect to make a little snuggly dog pile.  They have been together their whole lives, with an owner who absolutely adored them.  She could no longer care for them, so they have come to Home Fur Good in search of a new family.  Sparkletts was recently diagnosed with diabetes and requires daily insulin shots.  She has taken this event in stride and is simply happy to be feeling better.  These sisters are the quietest Chihuahuas on the block; they never got the yip yap memo!  Together they barely make one medium-sized dog; do not delay, call to meet these golden gals. name: ALMOND
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Almond is an older lady, and we all wish she could share her story with us.  She is estimated to be eight years old.  She is a skinny gal who would look perfect with a couple more pounds added to her current 15.  Almond is being labeled as a Shiba Inu and Parson Russell Terrier mix.  It is kind of fun to watch her explore, and guess the breeds that gave her a floofy fox tail or little Shar Pei-style ears.  Almond was a stray and when a group of well-intentioned people tried to catch her, she nipped one of them. This action landed her on the euthanasia list at county.  Home Fur Good spent some time with Almond and realized she acted out of fear.  Almond doesn’t have the eyesight or hearing of a young dog anymore.  These diminished senses, on top of not understanding what is going on, will put anyone in self-defense mode.  Almond also had an upper respiratory infection when she arrived, and no one is on their best behavior when they do not feel well.  Almond is slowly settling into the routines of HFG.  She loves getting out of her kennel and getting the opportunity to explore.  She is most happy being left to trot about, surveying her surroundings. The adoption fee is $150 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt ALMOND, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: Kira
location: Bully Pride of Arizona Bully Breed Advocacy & Community Resource Center City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Beautiful Kira! Miss Kira is quite awesome, she's a rockstar with her obedience and even knows her commands in both english and german. Kira is conditioned to a treadmill and a pro with agility. Kira is a high drive, very intelligent, loyal, amazing girl.

Kira's best match will be someone that under needs, a training background or training knowledge would be preferred and someone that has the time to help Kira be the best she can be. Hiking, biking, traveling, agility, and a very loyal companion and she also enjoys an evening watching a movie too. 

Kira is approx 4 yrs old, spayed chipped and ready to find someone just as awesome as she is.

Due to Kira's prey drive, No cats and absolutely no small dogs. Kira likes bigger dogs and is a good player with the right match. Dog intros are required.

Prior to a meet and greet, you are required to submit an adoption application. Please don't send an email through this site as it will not be answered. 

If you have serious interest, please go to the Bully Pride of Arizona website www.bullyprideofaz.com to submit your application. If your application indicates a possible match, we will call you to further discuss. Then, we will determine a meet and greet. We are looking for a certain type of home for Kira. Please understand our process. More info regarding the adoption process is also on our website. 

Kira comes with extensive training and she also comes with follow up training with her new adopter provided through JD's Powerhouse K9 Bootcamp.

Kira's adoption fee is $300.00 (home checks are required and no out of state adoptions)
Kira is spayed, chipped and current with her vaccinations.

Characteristics
Active, loyal, ahletic, protective, well trained, beautiful If you have any questions or would like to adopt Kira, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: GLINDA
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Glinda is the pretty gal at the shelter; you will find her sitting on her bed giving you the “come and get me” eyes.  Glinda was discovered at the county shelter.  She is a three-year-old, 27-pound Ibizan Hound mix.  She is outgoing and shy all at once.  Glinda carries just a tad bit of baggage. Her previous home was not the best for her and possibly contained some abuse.  Interested adopters will be given Glinda’s full scoop, but we are choosing to move forward, in this post, and focus on Glinda’s future home that will love her for who she is.  Glinda so badly wants to make new friends; she just asks that you initiate the interaction.  Moving slowly, talking softly and allowing Glinda to see your intentions will make big strides in gaining her trust.  She has been with Home Fur Good for several months, she has created many fans amongst workers and volunteers.  Many people want to see her in a loving home.  All interested adopters will get honest answers about Glinda and what her perfect home will look like.  Glinda is a smart girl and will sit for you when asked.  She is working hard on becoming a full fledged member of the Dog Walking Club.  She gets nervous out and about and takes a moment to read her surroundings.  Training with Glinda would create a very strong bond and would benefit both Glinda and her new family.   If you would like the prettiest new bestie, call 602-971-1334 to meet Glinda. The adoption fee for Glinda is $300, which is higher than it would be under our normal fee schedule. That is because she is one of our Guardian Angel dogs.  Guardian Angel dogs are highly desirable adoptees, and their increased fees are used expressly to help defray costs for our rescues with special needs such as advanced medical treatment or training for behavioral issues, or for those who are with us for unusually long periods of time.  In this way the Guardian Angels directly help our other rescues!  All adoption fees include spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt GLINDA, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: ALLEGRA
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Allegra approaches every day with her positive attitude and enthusiastic outlook. She has every right to be disgruntled, but she chooses to always have a glass half full. Since 2019 Allegra has been in a cycle of being homeless to being adopted and repeat. Allegra is a 50-pound Pit Bull mix ready to end the cycle and find her guaranteed forever home and family. She turns eight on December 23rd, a home would be the best gift. Over the years Allegra has lost her hearing and due to low stimulation and exercise she has acquired OCD issues, like hyper focusing on lights. She is a smarty pants, she knows the signs for sit, paw and circle. Allegra will do all her tricks with hand signals. When you are a bright girl like Allegra, you want to socialize and interact. She needs to exercise her body and mind, so she does not have idle time and require the need to entertain herself with obsessive activities. Allegra is currently on medication, for the OCD, which she will likely need to stay on for life. She also has some skin allergies, which Home Fur Good has easily treated with medicated baths. Allegra loves to go for walks and would make a great companion for daily tours of the neighborhood. She will do best as an only pet, and let us be honest, after all these years of searching, she deserves all of the attention. Allegra also enjoys puzzle toys and mats. She is not just a beautiful face; she is a thinker ready for a challenge. The adoption fee is $150 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment by calling 602-971-1334. If you have any questions or would like to adopt ALLEGRA, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: FIJI
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: The first time a Home Fur Good volunteer met Fiji, they exclaimed “Well, aren’t you exuberant.”  Exuberance is defined as being filled with or characterized by, a lively energy and excitement.  Yup, that is Fiji, lively energy, and excitement.  Fiji was turned in as a stray to the county shelter back on June 15th.  Home Fur Good fell in love with her freckles and then became enamored with her, well, her exuberance.  She is a stocky, 51-pound, Pitbull mix and she is three years old.  She will barrel her way into your heart.  Fiji has a love for tennis balls and squeaky toys.  So far, she is not tearing her precious finds apart, she just chomps and squeaks.  Fiji has a great response when you ask her to sit, and then offer a treat for her giant smile.  If you think you can meet her enthusiasm for life, give a call to meet your new furry girlfriend.  The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt FIJI, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: YOSHI
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Who likes big mutts?  We do!  We do!  Yoshi is a 70-pound Labrador and Mastiff mix.  He will turn four years old in January and he does have some Houdini-level skills.  In fact, he has escaped his homes so many times, he landed on the euthanasia list at county for having multiple intakes.  The first time Yoshi arrived at county was in January of 2022.  His March adoption family returned him in October for escaping too many times.  He was adopted out again quickly but returned a month later for, you guessed it, escaping.  OK, so that is what his forever family will need to commit to.  Figuring out how to keep an eye on a 70-pound mutt.  Some comments from his adopters are that he was kept mostly outside.  He would probably love a family that would like to hang out with him indoors.  They said Yoshi was friendly with kids and adults and knows “sit,” “shake,” and “lay down.” Yoshi’s owners said he was good with other dogs; Home Fur Good has started to look for a friend. Yoshi has had positive interactions with resident dogs with a solid history of liking other dogs.  Yoshi does play the game of fetch, but his preference is to roll over and request belly rubs. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt YOSHI, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: KONA
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Kona is very puppylike in her attitude toward life.  She has an innocence and curiosity in all the happenings at Home Fur Good.  Kona was discovered at the county shelter, and she is a three-year-old, 26-pound, Husky mix.  She does know the request to sit, but with a sparkle in her eye, she will sit and then hop up instantly to get as close to you as possible.  Kona will bring out your energetic spirit and next thing you know, you will be playing like a kid again. Kona must go to a home with no cats. If you want to bring positivity into your life, come, and adopt Kona.  The adoption fee for Kona is $300, which is higher than it would be under our normal fee schedule. That is because she is one of our Guardian Angel dogs.  Guardian Angel dogs are highly desirable adoptees, and their increased fees are used expressly to help defray costs for our rescues with special needs such as advanced medical treatment or training for behavioral issues, or for those who are with us for unusually long periods of time. All adoption fees include spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. name: RANDY
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Ahhh, what to say about RANDY? Home Fur Good loves this guy, and we know his perfect family is out there that will love him just the way he is. And the way Randy "is,"... is a bit special! ;-) Randy has had a few failed adoptions thus far, but we all know you don't often find true love on the first try. Randy has spent quite a bit of time with our trainer, who has helped us gain some more insight into his personality. 

To start, Randy is a FUN guy! He clearly has a talent for doggy modelling, and would love a forever home that takes lots and lots of pictures of his handsome face. Randy is always willing to pose with his "sit" and "paw" tricks, and will happily show them off for some treats. Randy has the perfect moderate energy level. Sometimes he enjoys a good run around the yard with a toy, and sometimes he's happy to curl up on a bed and chill out with a chew bone. Randy is affectionate with those he knows (he loves a good back scratch), but also independent enough to sniff around and explore on his own. In fact, Randy has quite the independent streak to him, which is part of what has made finding his perfect forever fit a bit of a challenge. Per Home Fur Good's trainer, Randy has quite a stubborn streak to him, and will do best in a home that sets boundaries while still allowing Randy to be Randy. He does not enjoy being "forced" to do things, and does not respond well to "discipline-based" dog training. Randy will do best in a home that loves him just the way he is, and is willing to get to know Randy on his terms. Randy will also do best in a home with no small children, and no other animals. 

We KNOW Randy's perfect person is out there waiting for him... could that person be YOU? Randy is currently in board and train with Home Fur Good's trainer in Phx. Call 602-971-1334 and we will get you in touch with Randy's trainer for a meet and greet. Randy's adoption fee is $150 and includes prior training, spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment only. If you have any questions or would like to adopt RANDY, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: DUG
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Dug, Doug, Dougie, Dug Dug! This handsome boy loves to be serenaded. He is six years old; he is a 68-pound Labrador Retriever and Pit Bull mix. Dug has been unlucky in finding a forever home. He was a much-adored longtimer at Maricopa County Animal Care and Control. Home Fur Good’s photographer used to volunteer at county and she instantly remembered Dug and was able to land him a spot at HFG. Dug was recently found as a stray and upon his pickup and drop-off at county, he was instantly recognized. His adopters chose not to have him back. Their loss is definitely HFG’s gain. Dug can look like a sad sack, just mopey and uninterested. There is a sure-fire way to get his tail wagging and put a spring in his step: just bring out the toys. Once the squeaks start, he is the happiest of boys. Dug is a fetch superstar; he not only retrieves but he instantly drops the toy at your feet, a highly sought-after skill.  Working with Dug, HFG has found that he is dog-selective, and he should be an only dog in his forever home. Dug has a doggie friend at HFG and they are left alone together in the yards and they happily go about their business together.   Dug’s right eye has an old injury and has some scarring and blindness, but it does not affect his fetch game. Dug is ready to find his loving forever home. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment only. If you have any questions or would like to adopt DUG, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: RIGBY
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Rigby was an owner surrender to the county shelter.  His owners did not have the time needed to meet the needs of puppy.  Rigby was born on January 7th, and he is a growing, 28-pound Pit Bull mix.  Rigby’s owners did try to do right by him, because he has the most amazing sit and he will hold the position, looking at you intently for more direction.  Rigby is an absolute love; he enjoys making the rounds in a room full of people.  He wants to say hello to everyone and make sure they know they are welcome into his circle of friends.  Rigby is true to his puppy nature, and he can be easily distracted by shiny, or squeaky, items!  Home Fur Good has been working with Rigby on his social skills with other dogs.  He comes in hot meeting other pups, and not all pups like that approach.  Another HFG dog resident, Kitty, does not mind Rigby’s style of play and she happily romps with him.  Rigby is just waiting for you to make the call to come and meet him. The adoption fee is $300 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt RIGBY, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: FRITO
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Frito is listed as a Chihuahua mix, but he appears very heavy on the mix.  If only it were easier to determine what makes some doggos so unique!  He is eight years young and weighs a whopping seven pounds.  Frito was initially found as a stray and taken to the county shelter.  He was adopted out and returned after four days.  Frito was wearing an e-collar after a recent neuter surgery and his adopter said he snapped at them when they were adjusting the collar.  That home had children and bigger dogs. They stated he was good with the children and showed fear toward the bigger dogs.  Home Fur Good found that Frito needs to cut back on the junk food; he was given a dental exam and ended up having 16 teeth removed.  Frito is feeling better and has only shown a desire to interact with anyone who wants to. Frito must go to a home with only older kids, not very young ones. Frito will paw at his kennel door and hop into any open arms that are offered to him. The adoption fee for Frito is $300, which is higher than it would be under our normal fee schedule. That is because he is one of our Guardian Angel dogs.  Guardian Angel dogs are highly desirable adoptees, and their increased fees are used expressly to help defray costs for our rescues with special needs such as advanced medical treatment or training for behavioral issues, or for those who are with us for unusually long periods of time.  In this way the Guardian Angels directly help our other rescues!  All adoption fees include spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt FRITO, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: SPROCKET
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Sprocket is a nine-year-old, fifty-nine-pound Pit Bull mix. He has had a pretty rough go searching for a forever home. He was found as a stray in July 2020 and taken to the county shelter. He was adopted in August 2020 and then returned in October 2020 for not getting along with the resident dog. Sprocket made himself a favorite at county. He was easy to leash and take in and out of his kennel. He would pull on the leash, but all his fans said that was because he was just so excited to get out on a walk and sniff, because sniffing is a job that Sprocket takes seriously. Once he settles from his initial excitement, Sprocket walks great on leash.  Home Fur Good has experienced this firsthand.  Sprocket is like a rocket on his way out of the shelter, but once he is on the sidewalk, he chills right out and enjoys every moment of the adventure.  Sprocket is affectionate with his human friends and recently did great on a little outing away from the shelter on a dog-friendly patio. Sprocket is a handsome guy with nine years of good-boy experience. He is always open to making new human friends. The hustle and bustle of shelter life is very distracting for Sprocket and your initial impression might not show how loving he really is. Take a moment to hang out for one-on-one time and you will see what a happy boy Sprocket is.  He isn’t treat or toy motivated, and volunteers were struggling with enrichment activities, trying to find his motivation.  Turns out, he will do anything for affection.  It is very sweet to watch him solve a puzzle and then get ready to shower you with kisses.  Sprocket would love to meet you and show you his happy dance when you give him a booty scratch. Sprocket is currently in a foster home, but he is still looking for his permanent forever. If you would like to meet him, please call the shelter (602-971-1334) to arrange an appointment. The adoption fee is $150 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment only. If you have any questions or would like to adopt SPROCKET, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: WAYNE
location: Home Fur Good City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Wayne is a very reserved doggo.  He is calm, cool and collected, he does not concern himself with minor stresses.  Wayne is well mannered; he will even offer his paw for a shake after he sits like a Good Boy.  Wayne has a very peaceful energy; he likes to sit with his people and chillax.  He is a young boy, just three years old, but he has an old soul.  He weighs 52 pounds, and he is listed as a Harrier and Shar Pei mix.  While at the county shelter, his tail was amputated due to a case of Happy Tail, which is when a dog is such a wagger that they nick the end, and it will not heal.  Wayne took a moment to learn to wag his nubbin’.  Wayne’s forever family is going to need to understand that Wayne will need time to decompress, become comfortable and to become secure in his forever home. This is not an overnight process. The general guideline is three days to decompress, three weeks to become comfortable and three months to become secure. Wayne has been with Home Fur Good for almost a year, and prior to that he was in the county shelter.  Wayne has been adopted, but in some cases, he was not even given three days to settle in.  He needs a family with a big heart, that will give him time to understand that he truly is home.  Wayne has shown some separation anxiety, and this is a behavior that can be addressed, but his forever family will need to be committed to working with Wayne. Wayne is an amazing boy, who loves to hang with his humans, he deserves the effort required to become the best boy he can be. Wayne would do best in a home as an only dog, and must go to a home with no cats.. He does politely coexist with other similarly tempered dogs, but in a home, he has shown he does not care to share his humans. Wayne has many good manners; he will sit when asked and he has a calm demeanor. Wayne does not have much to say and likes to sit and watch the world go by. Wayne is and will be a devoted human companion, he just needs to find those with giant hearts, patience and time to help gain back his self-confidence. The adoption fee is $225 and includes spaying/neutering, age-appropriate vaccinations, microchipping, and a free wellness visit at Phoenix Mountain Animal Hospital. Our adoption hours are Thursday-Saturday from 11:00 am-4:00 pm by appointment. If you have any questions or would like to adopt WAYNE, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

She is playful but also enjoys hanging out and snuggling. She is looking for her forever home.    Gwennie enjoys meeting new Humans with proper introduction (she get's super excited)! walks well on leash and minds her own business. She is selective with her dog friends, if you have another dog a dog intro is required. She is an inside dog but requires a backyard to explore, play ball and zoomies-zoom-zoom! She will be an amazing companion to enjoy new adventures with then cuddle up and watch Netflix!     She is smart, a quick learner. name: Elliott
location: FREEDOM BROTHERS RESCUE City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Eliott is approx 1-1.5 yr old, neutered,Black and white lab/pit mix with a huge heart. Eliott likes other dogs and would do well with a friendly, non-reactive and non-dominant dog to lead him. He has been working on his leash skills and loves to go on walks. He has also been practicing riding in the car and is doing great with this. Eliott likes to chase cats and though he has not hurt cats before, his prey-drive can be intimidating to the smaller species. Eliott loves to play with toys, he especially likes stuffed toys. Eliott has been crate trained for when the humans are out of the house and knows the command "go in your crate. He is working on other commands like "sit and "stay. Eliott will snuggle with you for hours and doesn't require a ton of exercise, one walk per day has been sufficient for him to relax. He is a great dog and would thrive in a home without cats or small animals to chase. Eliott used to be a stray, so he can be timid and fearful of new people. Once he warms up, he loves to play and snuggle. He's ready for his fur-ever home! He is up to date on vaccines, and microchipped. name: Pickles
location: ForeverFelines/Fidos - Phoenix Area City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hi there, I’m Pickles. I’m a very handsome 4-month-old black “ghost or shadow” tabby. I’m the kind of tabby where my outer coat is solid black, and my tabby markings are in my inner coat. You can see those faint tabby markings in the right light. So if you like black cats (black cats are considered lucky in many places in the world) that  are super cool, that’s me 😉 So far in my life I’ve been very very, lucky. My mom was rescued a few weeks before I and my siblings were born so we had the great luck of being born into a family with people big and little. We’re now the sweetest & friendliest kittens you’d ever want to meet. How lucky! And you and I will be very lucky when we find each other!  And if you like BIG Boys that's me too - well not yet , but soon. In the first picture, that's me in the front - the big guy!

I’m a very friendly kitten and I'm a talker. I like attention and I get it by asking you to love me. I play with the other kitties at my foster home and with the humans too – both big (adults) and little (kids). I’ll sleep on your bed, your lap and by your side. I’m always up for petting and snuggling. And I’ve never met a cat toy or cat-tree I didn’t like!  

I’m all ready for my new forever home because I’m neutered, I’ve had my vaccines including rabies, I’ve been dewormed AND I’ve been chipped. Whew, I’m all set to go to my forever family. I’m still very young and I’ll be lonely being an only kitty (especially after having lots of kitties to play with at my foster home) so my favorite would be to find a forever family with another young kitty or you could always adopt me with one of my siblings too! I could love one person or a whole family of people - I'm not picky. I haven’t been around dogs yet but being so young, I'll probably be fine if the dog is friendly to kitties. If you’d like to have a sweet, handsome, playful addition to your family, I’m your boy. I’ll be waiting to hear from you!  

P.S. This is an adorable kitten that needs and deserves a loving family home. So, if you are willing and able to adopt this striking and cuddly boy, please email drtweets2@msn.com or call/text 602-757-9791 and ask for Deb. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Pickles, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Rosie Belle
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ
story: **LOOKING FOR A SPECIAL ADOPTER!**  Hello, my name is Rosie Belle! I am a 1 year old Tabby with a splash of Bengal mix! I have such gorgeous gray fur and my big green eyes really make me stand out! I had a rough start in life as a homeless kitty, but my life has completely changed with this amazing opportunity to be a loved family member! I am a shy kitty due to having to contend with homelessness and I am searching for an adopter who has experience with helping kitties like me to acclimate. With the right person I am gentle, I can be handled, I am well mannered and easy to care for. AND, my purr is very soothing and I love kitty massages!  I need an experienced cat whisperer who will work with me to overcome my shyness, and I thrive in a serene home environment. I get along very well with other cats and they all love me because of my gentle and kind nature. If you are experienced and would like to help a cat who would otherwise be overlooked due to being shy, and are up for a kitty project, then I would be ideal for you and you could change my life! **  My adoption fee has been waived if you have a vet reference!**  I am spayed, vaccinated, negative for feline leukemia, microchipped and come with food, new toys and new cat tree! If you specifically have experience with acclimating cats who need socialization help and can give me a lifetime home, please email live.love.meow@gmail.com directly for a matchmaking questionnaire! Or, you can find the matchmaking questionnaire here: http://meowness.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/MEOWness-Matchmaking-Questionnaire.doc If you have any questions or would like to adopt Rosie Belle, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Zoey
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hello, my name is Zoey! I am a 1 year old Bengal and Tabby mix girl! I am so beautiful with my racy spotted and striped coat and my big green eyes! I am very kind and I have a loving heart. I was rescued from being born into homelessness and I am afraid at first and in need of an adopter who has experience with acclimating kitties who need support with boosting their social skills and getting acclimated in new settings. I do well in a serene home environment and I get along great with other kitties! With the right patient, experienced person, I am also quite cuddly and love to sit on laps, watch Netflix and purr with delight! My $45 adoption fee includes vet check, spay, vaccinations, negative feline leukemia test, microchip, my vet records, food, lots of new toys and New Cat Tree! If you have experience with helping kitties who will be scared at first and can provide a lifetime home, and if you also have a solid cat history including a veterinarian, please email live.love.meow@gmail.com directly for a matchmaking questionnaire! Or, you can find the matchmaking questionnaire here: http://meowness.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/MEOWness-Matchmaking-Questionnaire.doc
P.S. When you email, please include details about your experience with kittens like me so that I know that you have read my bio. Thanks much! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Zoey, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Maia
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ
story: Hello, my name is Maia! My name means brave warrior! I am a 3 year old Bengal and Tabby mix girl! I am so stunning with my unique spotted coat, my vibrant splashes of coloring, my extra long whiskers, and my big copper eyes! I really enjoy getting kitty massages and my purr is quite soothing!  I am a special needs cat because I was born with a liver shunt. That means that my liver doesn't filter out ammonia and I have to take two inexpensive meds- lactulose and metronidazole- and also eat a special diet of low fat protein, including turkey, canned clams (for taurine), with a side of rice. I really love this food! On my diet and meds, I am just like any other cat! I am on the search for an adopter who thinks it is no big deal that I have special needs and would like to give me my big break! I get along well with other cats and small dogs! I have been up for adoption my whole life and I try to remain hopeful that someone will want to adopt a cat who has been overlooked. I have not had any health issues and I am going strong, I just need my special diet and meds, much like many people.  My adoption fee has been waived as long as you have a vet reference, and I am spayed, vaccinated, negative for feline leukemia, microchipped, and come with my food, starter meds, and a new cat tree!  If you can give me a lifetime home where I have my meds and special diet, and if you are also an experienced cat owner with a veterinarian, please email live.love.meow@gmail.com directly for a matchmaking questionnaire! Or, you can find the matchmaking questionnaire here: http://meowness.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/MEOWness-Matchmaking-Questionnaire.doc If you have any questions or would like to adopt Maia, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Piper
location: MEOWness Cat Adoptions City: Glendale, AZ

story: This sweet little ham was surrendered to us because the family is moving and they don't wabt to take him to their new home. He does use a dog door but is still a lilttle shy with it. He does great with other dogs of all ages and sizes. He does well with older kids , he is NOT a fan of young kids who want to squeeze him. name: Rudolph
location: The Wolf Pack Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Im Rudolph ! 
I came into rescue from a hoarding house of 140 dogs in Glendale AZ. I've lived a rough , dirty life and I'm experiencing a lot of new first here in my foster home. I got my OWN bed , my OWN crate and even my OWN food bowl! I am a VERY happy boy with so much love to give! I do good with kids who are a little older and respect animals. I dont know what a cat is , I've never seen one. I do great with other dogs, I'm learning to walk on a leash , I've mastered the dog door while being in my foster home. I have a hard time understanding I'm allowed in the house but My foster mom is reminding me of that daily and I get very happy to go into different rooms. I would love a home with another dog but I wouldn't mind being on my own either , I'm just happy to be out of the place I came from. 
We do require the other dogs in the home to be up to date on vaccines and fixed. Email aafpintake@gmail.com or 602-736-9523 We currently accept Zelle , Venmo and Cash. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Rudolph, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Dior
location: The Wolf Pack Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Hey friends !

My name is Dior and I'm alllll pug ! I have a TON of energy and will need a family that has experience with pugs! When I first came to the rescue I had zero potty training, I now use a dog door but I will need another dog in the house to encourage good behavior with me. My foster mom says Im crazy , I can  tear up just about anything if given the chance , I even raided the food pantry and came out with a box of tissues !!! I do great playing with toys , I love going for car rides and yes I love kids who are a little older and nice to me. I am crate trained due to the fact I will chew about anything ,  foster mom says that will level out over time but not for another 6 months or so. If there are other dogs in the home we do ask they be up to date on vaccines and fixed. 
We will get a lot of emails for Dior , but we want the best fit , someone with pug experience and a vet reference. Accepted payment at this time is Zelle ,Venmo or cash .  For fastest response on the weekends you can email afpintake@gmail.com or 602-736-9523 If you have any questions or would like to adopt Dior, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Sampson
location: The Wolf Pack Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
My Name is Sampson ! I was rescued from a older lady in buckeye who was able to care for me. I ended up in her hands because someone adopted me from the shelter for a " Reduced fee " and then I was re-sold (for a profit) to the nice lady that had to give me up. I have been through a journey in such a short time but I've been doing great in my current foster home since November 2021  . Im a SUPER sweet submissive boy , I only have one eye and unfourtnatley Im 80% blind in that eye , But i have the BIGGEST heart , I'm doing my very best to keep up with potty training , it's hard when you can't see but I'm getting better. I wear belly bands with no issues and I am very smart with my hearing. My foster mom has worked with me so much and she says I'm one of the smartest dogs she's had in rescue!!!  Im pretty dog friendly but a meet n greet is a must ! If another dog is mean to me or picks on me , I will defend myself so I might do best as a only dog, if they try to bully me, I haven't been around cats so I'm not sure of them. I do walk on a leash and I'm fully crate trained. I know how to use a doggie door to come inside , it's the going out part I'm working on. I travel great , I LOVE belly rubs and will play for HOURS ! Im considered a basset hound / Dachshund , and I have some serious muscle tone so I will need someone who can handle a 35-40 pound bundle of joy on their lap .....
So we rescued Sampson from a lady who bought him not knowing anything about him , he truly has been a absolute delight to foster and get to know , he traveled 4 hours to heber with us for thanksgiving and did great up on 5 acres running around,He attends EVERY adoption event in the last 8 months , with absolutely NO INTEREST...... 
  We are a small - nonprofit-foster based rescue , If you would like to Meet Sampson or any of our other dogs please call 602-736-9523 for fastest response , Please Note we are located in Glendale and hold adoption events on  Saturdays from 11am - 3pm. We do not accept Checks ,Sampson is Neutered , up to date on vaccines , chipped , comes with adoption supplies as well as a crate. Wc do offer a 72 hour trial with sampson as well. He would so well with a fenced yard/patio . Thank you If you have any questions or would like to adopt Sampson, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

She is a absolute sweet heart , We have been treating her for a eye infection , of her left eye , from her previous enviroment. She loves other dogs , she has never seen a cat before and she does well with older kids who respect dogs. She is learning to walk on a leash and is doing better with car rides. name: Jax
location: Help a Dog Smile City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Hi, I'm Jax aka Jingles.  I'm a 10 month old puppy who is playful and energetic. I love hiking and car rides. I am currently working on my leash and play manners with my foster family. I was on my own before, just trying to survive so I didn't get a chance to work on those skills before...but I am now!            As you might imagine I love food and treats of all kinds, playing and hanging out with other dogs and humans. I can be a little timid meeting new people but I'm great with meeting new dogs. My ideal match would be in a home with another medium/large dog companion that likes to play and hang together and humans who want to spend time with me. I hope we get to meet soon!            If you are interested in adding a big ole flopping energetic pup to your home please fill out an application at *     https://helpadogsmile.org/adoption-application/     .   Jax has an adoption fee of $350 that helps us cover vet expenses. He is neutered, microchipped, has his rabies, bordetella  and parvo/distemper series of vaccinations. name: Mr. Jingle
location: Help a Dog Smile City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Hi! My name is Mr. Jingles and I am an adorable Chihuahua! As you can see by my pictures, I am obviously the cutest boy in the world! My ears sometimes pick up satellite signals. We’re not sure what my life was like before the nice people at Help A Dog Smile took me in. My foster mommy and daddy are amazed that I have house manners like I know potty belongs outside, I don’t chew on things, and I am great at lounging on the couch. Duh! Does not every dog have manners? I had an appointment with one of those doggie doctors and I am now neutered, vaccinated for rabies and distemper/parvo, and microchiped. My foster mom says that I am a sweet and playful little boy. I love going on walks and sniffing all around. I have enjoyed meeting other dogs and kids. I would probably get along with cats just fine too. When I get excited, I like to wag my little tail nub with all my mighty dog power. It is silly, I know but I love to let people know I am a happy guy. It is one way I communicate because I am hard of hearing. I need a family that can teach me hand signals and touch. Once we learn how to talk to each other it will be smooth sailing. I like to make people happy and if ya give me a little treat I will learn quickly! It is likely that I am gonna live for a long time, like 10 years, so you hafta treat me like a family member cuz I am not disposable for any reason, like if you are moving, having babies, or for any reason! If you are interested in making me a permanent member of your family, please fill out our online application:   http://www.helpadogsmile.org/adopt/application/ . Check out my videos too! https://youtu.be/S6N2CSMvM1o and https://youtu.be/6BDhgkSdLxc.December 14, 2022, 12:35 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mr. Jingle, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Jasper

story: Are you looking for a scruffy 15-lb cutie with an adorable underbite? How about a best friend who gets along with all people and animals? If your answer is ‘yes’, Jasper might be just the guy for you! Jasper is approximately 1.5 years old and appears to be mixed with border terrier and brussels griffon. We may not know his breed, but we do know that he is a very good boy! That's what matters most, right? Jasper is crate trained and gets along great with cats, dogs of all sizes, and kids of all ages. He enjoys playing with dogs in his foster home then relaxing on the couch with his foster mom when he’s done. Overall, he is a calm and quiet boy.      Jasper is neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. His adoption fee of $350 helps offset the cost of medical expenses. name: Justin
location: Cool Cats Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Meet Justin!!! He is looking for his fur-ever hero to adopt him. We think he is about 10-12 years old and would need a home that understands his needs. He's a very shy senior who has probably had a tough life prior to arriving at the shelter. He was skipped over by many rescues and adopter due to his shy and defensive behavior. Justin is more of a ladies man we think and would prefer a no kid, female only home. He does not like to be picked up or put on leash so he can be a challenge. He does like to sit on his blankets and enjoy some sunshine near the window.  Justin requires a diet that includes some lunch meat mixed into his kibble.. yep turkey needs to be included if you want him to tolerate kibble.. hot dogs work too. I am assuming his life as a stray or unkept chi chi meant he was thrown scraps and developed a taste for the people food. We know we are looking for a unicorn of an adopter but felt this kid deserves a chance off the streets/shelter to have a real home.. He is located in Cave Creek, AZ for meet & greets. He is using potty pads and an x-pen but will go in a kennel if needed for traveling in and out of an enclosed dog run. Again.. he will not tolerate leash walking so you will need a place contained to make potty breaks better for all involved. Adoption Fee is $200. He has been vet checked, neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped.          December 15, 2022, 9:56 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt Justin, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Teo
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG *Phoenix Metro Area Only*  Could this guy be any cuter?  And the underbite…the best ever!  Teo is a 3-4 year old, 10 pound Rat terrier/Chihuahua mix who came to Pathways from the County shelter.  Teo “The Entertainer” is such a joy and a bundle of fun.  He is a happy little guy whose butt is always wiggling because his tail is always wagging! You can’t help but smile and be happy when you are around him and loves to do happy zoomies.   He likes toys….no,wait, he LOVES toys, especially the soft ones with squeakers in them and he is a fetching machine.  He loves walks, play time and making sure all is well with his world!   Teo walks well on a leash and will look to his owner for direction and acceptance. He is crate trained and sometimes will go into his crate to hang out and play with one of his squeaky toys.  He is potty trained (but will need to be taken out on a regular basis until he gets into a routine).  He does love having another active dog to play with and would do well in that situation. Any children should be at least 12 years old and of a respectful and gentle nature. Teo would love a home where he has someone around most of the time.  Teo is a little cautious when meeting new people and with new sounds that can be construed as fear, but he is easily assured and will make friends quickly with humans or dogs, especially if the humans have a treat!  Teo comes with his collar, harness, leash, vaccinations and is microchipped. His adoption fee is $280.  If you are interested in this sweet boy, please visit our website at: https://pwrescue.org and click on the "Adopt" button at the top of the page to complete an application.Pathways Home Animal Rescue December 16, 2022, 10:53 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Teo, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Wiley & Mia (Pair)
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG  “Some call me a senior dog. That just means I have years of experience in the fine art of friendship.”    Wiley (Chihuahua/Pomeranian mix-11 years old) and Mia (Min-Pin/Chihuahua mix 10 years old)    Are you ready to open up your heart and home to this sweet senior pair? Do you know someone who would like two amazing companions? They are the easiest dogs in the world…why are they still waiting for their forever home? It makes no sense to us.…  They may be seniors, but still have lots of life left in them!    They LOVE to go on walks and are great on a leash. They are sweet as pie, snuggle bunnies and are very easy keepers who just want to live out their lives in a quiet home with lots of love!    They are potty trained, love to cuddle and don’t bark. They would love a home with a retired couple or someone who is home most of the time. Mia is a bit of an escape artist and she is very fast, so it would be best to have a home with a secure fenced yard for them to go out to potty in.    They are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, and will go to their new home with collars, harnesses and leashes.    If you are interested in these sweethearts, please visit our website:  https://pwrescue.org/   and click on the "Adopt" tab to complete an application. name: Zeus
location: Help a Dog Smile City: Phoenix, AZ
story: UPDATE:  check out Zues's newest photos along with his bestie, Gracie, also available to adopt!  Zues is a 3.5 year old blend of shephard, lab and pittie. He is a great guy whose owner realized that this breed needs exercise and is not made for couch potato apartment living! He loves to be active and be with his people:) Toys and fetch keep him plenty busy and he loves his walks! He is 100% housetrained with a dog door and he loves to charge around the yard in his foster home. He is good on a leash and loves walks! Zues needs a yard to run in or an exercise plan as he is an active dog who loves to be on the go!  Probably not a good match for cats. Zeus is dog selective and does best with female dogs that are about his size and like to play:) He LOVES to go hiking  and walking!  Zues has an adoption fee of $250 and he is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. name: Jovi
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG **PHOENIX METRO AREA ONLY**  Meet Jovi!  Jovi is 1-year-old, 45 pound Lab/Terrier mix who is looking for a dog savvy, active, energetic family who can keep up with him!  Jovi will need plenty of playtime, toys and exercise in his new home.  He is looking for a family with plenty of time and patience for obedience training…..the terrier in him can make him a bit stubborn at times, so consistency and guidance will be necessary for him to succeed and quality treats for a reward are always a plus!  Since coming to Pathways, he is learning his manners and will need to continue learning commands. His foster mom is training him on come, wait, leave it, sit, and stay and his new family will need to continue this training to help him be the best he can be!  He likes mental stimulation like puzzles with hidden food or any other stimulating games, but he also can be very relaxed and just lounge around with you on the couch.  He can entertain himself and be silly with his toys and would love to have a playful canine companion at least his size.  We suggest no small dogs in the home.  He is still a big clumsy puppy who doesn't know his size and strength, so proper introductions to dogs and people are always necessary.  Any children in the home should be at least 12 years old and have some experience with dogs. Jovi will require a secure, fenced yard that allows for a lot of exercise.  He is a smart, energetic puppy who loves companionship of people and other dogs.  He is a very loving boy who craves attention and lots of exercise!  He is crate trained (if needed), rides well in the car, is housebroken and loves all toys and games, but is not fond of cats, so NO cats please!  Jovi is an excellent companion and as he matures, will be the perfect addition to an active family or couple who love to go hiking or walking!  Jovi is one of those dogs who wants to be your best friend and what a great friend he would be!  Jovi is neutered, up to date on vaccinations and microchipped.  He will go to his new home with a collar, harness and leash.  His adoption fee is $480.00.  If you are interested in this sweet boy, please visit our website at:  https://pwrescue.org and click on the “Adopt” button at the top of the page to complete an application.  Meet and greets can be set up with approved applications.Pathways Home Animal Rescue December 16, 2022, 10:53 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Jovi, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Molly & Shadow
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG Molly and Shadow are an adorable 7-year-old pair who came to the rescue when their owners could no longer care for them.    SHADOW:  Shadow is an approximately 7-year-old, 20 pound, female black Jack Russell mix who came to the rescue with her best friend, Molly.  They are a pair and will need to be adopted together.    Shadow is the more active of the two and loves to play and LOVES toys, especially her ball. She is a power chewer though, so she must have durable balls.  She will play fetch for hours! . She gets VERY excited about the ball, so any adopters with kids would need to be aware that they will need to be careful and patient when getting the ball from her.  Shadow is an absolute ray of sunshine who literally smiles when she meets people and is a cuddle bug.  She loves giving hugs when you come in the room and smiles when she is playing with her ball...it's her happy place!  She is a very sweet dog who is great with other dogs, has the energy of a puppy, but is well behaved and potty trained, so the best of all worlds!    MOLLY:  Her buddy, Molly, is a 7-year-old , 10 pound female Chihuahua mix.   She is a very stoic little girl. She is very sweet and gets excited to greet you, but very calm and stoic. She doesn’t get overly excited or wound up over anything, and is pretty even keel.  She is a very simple girl who doesn't need a lot...just feed her, sit and cuddle with her and she’ll be your best friend.  She loves being with her best friend, Shadow, and doesn’t seem to care much about other dogs, but certainly tolerates them. She can be a little bossy around other dogs if she feels like her space is being invaded. She is not real interested in playing with toys...she would much prefer just cuddling with you on the couch!  Both Shadow and Molly are up to date on vaccines, spayed/neutered, and microchipped.  They will go to their new home with collars, harnesses and leashes.  The adoption fee is $200.00 for the pair.    If you would like to add these sweethearts to your family, please visit our website at:  https://pwrescue.org and click on the "Adopt" button at the top of the page to complete an application.      Pathways Home Animal Rescue December 16, 2022, 10:53 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Molly & Shadow, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Noelle
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG Meet Noelle!  This beautiful, shy little girl is a 5-year-old, 11 pound Chihuahua/terrier mix who is looking for an extra patient forever family to call her own!  She is fearful of new people and a slow approach with her is necessary.  She will need a new owner(s) with lots of patience and who will not introduce her to too many new people all at once.  She is not the kind of dog you will immediately be able to pick up, carry around or get affection from right away.  It takes a while for her to come around, but once she does, she is very sweet and loyal.  She says she’s worth the wait!!  Noelle would do well in a home with another gentle but confident canine companion about her size, to help guide her along in life.  She tends to pattern her behavior after other normal dogs when she doesn’t know how to act in a situation where she is afraid.  Because of her fears, it will be best for her to be in a home with a secure, fenced in yard rather than an apartment or condo where she needs to be taken out to potty on a leash.  Noelle is looking for a mature, dog savvy family and a home that is on the quiet side….she would NOT do well in a very active home where there is a lot of noise or young children in the home.  She would do best in a home with someone who works from home or someone who is retired and is around a lot.  Any children in the home should be at least 12-14 years old and of a kind, gentle, quiet nature and should be dog savvy.   Noelle is potty trained, but will need reinforcement in a new home environment until she has a set schedule and routine. She knows basic commands like sit, shake, wait, stay, leave it.  She will do okay in a crate, but would prefer not to be in one for very long.   Noelle is up to date on shots, spayed and microchipped.  Noelle’s adoption fee is $250.00.  If you think you would be a good fit for this sweetheart, please visit our website at https://pwrescue.org and click on the “Adopt” button at the top of the page to complete an application. Pathways Home Animal Rescue December 16, 2022, 10:53 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Noelle, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Champ
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG Check out this cute little nugget!  Champ is a 5-6 year old long haired Chihuahua who currently weighs a whopping 6 pounds!  He is the sweetest little guy you will have met in a while!  He came to Pathways after being lost and then found by a good samaritan who contacted Pathways for help.  Unfortunately, we were not able to find his family.  Because of how he acts with other dogs and in a home, we feel he clearly that he had a family somewhere before.  He has excellent manners and a sweet, gentle disposition.  He may be short of stature but he excels at how huge his heart is!  He is a Mr. "Loves everyone" kinda guy who doesn't seem to get flustered with new dogs or people.  He isn't fond of cats...barks at them!  So, no cats please!   He loves to snuggle, play a little with toys, loves belly rubs, and always ready with tail wags!   Because he is such a little guy, we feel he may be overlooked in a busy, active home with a lot of other dogs, and believe he will do best in a home with maybe one other dog or also simply with just you and him!  Because of his small size, any children in the home should be older (at least 10-12) and of a gentle, responsible nature.  Champ is up to date on shots, neutered and microchipped.  His adoption fee is $280.00. Barney is a very strong boy who is very much a puppy and will require a home where his new owners will take the time to teach him some proper doggie manners such as how to walk on a leash, no jumping, no barking, etc.   Barney is not a chewer but will definitely need some chew toys as most puppies do.  Barney is very adventurous and always looking for action.. name: Oliver
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG Meet Oliver!!  Oliver is a 1-1/2 year old, 20 pound, Chihuahua/Pug mix (what we fondly refer to as a “Chug”)!  He’s a very sweet boy with a pretty amazing underbite!  Oliver was found as a stray and we were unable to find his owners.  He is a very sweet boy who is very playful and loves toys… in fact, he loves them so much he usually carries one around is his mouth most of the time!   Oliver enjoys playing with other dogs and would prefer another playful dog in the home.  He is very gentle with the senior dog in his current foster home and even gets her to play now and then!   Oliver is potty trained and rides well in the car and is always up for an outing to Starbucks for a Puppuccino!  His foster mom has been working on basic obedience training with him and he is very eager to learn (hint…he is very treat motivated)!  He is not a big barker and is learning commands like “off” and “no bark”.  He will need a home where his owner(s) will continue working on obedience and leash training so that he can become his best self!  Since he was stray, we don’t know anything about his previous life, so we are not sure about how he is around kids but according to his foster mom, his whole body shakes with happiness when the neighbor kids are playing outside, but we would prefer any children in the home be at least 12 years old and of a kind, gentle and respectful nature.  He loves people but seems to prefer women a wee bit more than men….  Oliver does have some slight allergies which are under control on a lamb and sweet potato dog food (no chicken).   Oliver is up to date on vaccinations, neutered and microchipped.  He will go to his new home with a collar, harness and leash.  His adoption fee is $300.00.
