name: Fonzie
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG Aayyyy Fonzie here!  I'm looking for a forever home.  I’m a Lhasa Apso/Shihtzu mix, about 2-3 years old and I weigh 12 pounds.  I'm up to date on my shots, neutered and microchipped.  I like to growl, but I’m not aggressive and don’t bite. I was saved from the county shelter 2 hours before I was going to be euthanized for growling and a rescuer whisked in and took me home.  Whew, that was a close one!  My foster mom let me decompress for over a week and then I went to the groomer. I growled at her but I was a good boy and I didn’t need a muzzle.  I was so adorable after I was groomed because my beautiful eyes were visible.  My foster mom tells me how handsome I am and I love it because I think I’m handsome too. Tee hee!  I am house trained. I love to go outside, run around in the yard and chase the birds away.  I get along with other dogs but I don’t want to play with them. If your dog wants a playmate, I’m probably not the best choice for you. I don’t growl at my foster siblings, only humans; I like the company of my foster siblings and we take naps together.  My foster mom doesn’t crate me when she goes away because I don’t do anything wrong!  At night, I sleep under the bed on a fluffy blanket. I LOVE to go for walks! I dance around and bite the leash with excitement!  Just so you know, I do not like to be picked up....I am a “4 on the floor” kind of guy...  I probably won’t do well with young kids who want to pick me up or play with me.  If you want a dog that you can carry around and snuggle with, I'm probably not your guy... but I do love it when my foster mom pets me and tells me I’m such a good boy. I don’t growl as much, because I love when she pets me.  I jump on her leg asking for more attention.  It’s pretty cool to feel loved. I hope to find a forever home where my family will give me time to adjust at my own speed and will understand my "quirks" and who will love me until the end of my days...  If you’re interested in meeting me, you can complete an adoption application at https://pwrescue.org/ and click on the "Adopt" button at the top of the page.  My adoption fee is $300.00.    Pathways Home Animal Rescue December 16, 2022, 10:53 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Fonzie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Willy
location: Pathways Home Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: PWRESCUE.ORG *Phoenix Metro Area Only*   Willy (male) Breed: Norwich Terrier/chihuahua mix Age: 4 yrs  Weight: 12 lbs  Ok with dogs, cats unknown Ok with older kids Adoption Fee: $300  Willy was picked up by Arizona Humane Society (AHS) with possible injuries, possibly from a dog attack.  Willy’s injuries were  treated and he was made  available for a rescue.  He has always been very shy and unsure, and under socialized.  He has gradually become slightly more social but likely to always be shy and will need patience and time to bond to new owner/family.   Willy should have another friendly playful dog in the home to help with his social skills.  He is likely to be a "runner" for a few months until he bonds with his new family, gets the schedule and routine.  He will require a secure fenced yard to keep him safe. Once he feels safe with you he is very affectionate. He would do best in calm home and be slowly introduced to anyone coming into the house. He has never attempted to bite due to fear but a slow approach is best and he does well enticed with treats. Willy would benefit from consistent training and socialization to encourage his confidence. He is a very sweet boy.  Willy will join his new owner with a collar, harness, and a leash. He is vaccinated, altered and microchipped. Meet and greets will be set up on approved applications only. A canine companion is a requirement to adopt Willy. name: Tyler

Tyler would love to learn basic obedience (or more!) to be an even better companion for his people!  Tyler does get along with other dogs and even with a terrier tough attitude will submit to a more dominant dog. name: Willa
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Willa is an adorable cream colored Chihuahua who is approximately 4 1/2 years old. She is only 8 lbs and has long glamorous legs and a sleek, fit body. She is very laid back and not nervous or high strung like some chihuahuas. She is content to hang out with you on the couch or go out for a walk. She is not a barker either. She barks appropriately but never excessively. She had some minor eye surgery to correct her lower eyelids which turned in just a bit too far. Willa is a little bit "special." It's a bit hard to describe. Maybe she is a little autistic? She is just a bit different. She is very sweet, gets along with all of the other dogs and is a pleasure to be around. Willa needs a stable home where she will never again have to fear for her safety.     Like many of our rescued dogs we are not sure how well housebroken Willa is. But with some consistency and patience we know she will be a quick study!    Willa is a short coated dog and will require some brushing and occasional nail trims.     Willa's adoption fee is $275.00    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.         If you have any questions or would like to adopt Willa, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

Adelaide, aka Addy, is a sweet and energetic girl! She would love to be included on all sorts of outdoor activities to help burn off some energy. name: Basia
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: How many pounds does it take to break the ice? About 122.6 pounds to be exact! Howdy, I'm Basia and even at that weight I could even stand to gain a few. Currently my favorite snacks consist of chicken jerky and wet food, wink wink. I travelled all the way from New Mexico in hopes of finding the perfect place to lay my head. I'm a bit shy when first meeting new people, but once I get cozy, I'm the biggest lap dog you know. I love to snuggle on the bed and I'll paw at you if the pets aren't enough. I like to play with the occasional stuffed toy, but following my human friends around is my favorite pastime. Since I'm such a large gal, I will need a home with a fenced yard to stretch my legs. I have met other doggos while in HALO's care, but would recommend bringing any new friends down to ensure things get off on the right paw. Since I do take some time to warm up, I need a calm, low traffic home where I'm able to come around at my own pace and 18+ for anyone in the home. I do have a set of jowls on me, so be ready for the occasional shower or drool puddle on the couch! If you want a small horse (or large pony) living in your house with you, come on down to HALO (with snacks) and request to come meet me! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Basia, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Lisa & Revy (Bonded Pair)
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Lisa is an adorable Yorkshire Terrier female who is the mother of Revy and will only be adopted with Revy. While we recognize that they will be separated eventually, we choose not to separate them at the hardest time in their lives which is losing their lifetime home and then getting in to a new one. Their owners were moving and did not feel the move would be good for the dogs. Revy is 10 years old and Lisa is 14or at least that is what we were told. They had no records for the dogs and it is possible (and likely) they lost track of their ages as they do not seem to be that old. But they are seniors none the less. They are absolute sweethearts and very gentle, kind dogs. They just want a place to live out their lives with peace and love where no one will give up on them again. Both dogs were spayed upon coming to the rescue. Lisa had some mammary masses removed and Revy had her teeth cleaned. (Lisa has no teeth but still eats dry food!) These girls are just precious and very small and we want them to have a wonderful home, preferably with no other dogs and definitely without a dog door since they are so small and would be easy prey for predators. They are current on vaccinations and microchipped as well.     Revy and Lisa are coated dogs (hair grows continuously) They require some brushing and professional grooming every 6-8 weeks or so.     Revy and Lisa's combined adoption fee is $475    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Rock would love a friend near his age and size to play with but would probably do ok alone if he gets enough interaction and stimulation from his family. He came from a breeder, so he did not receive.as much attention and guidance in his younger months. He still may pull on your pant leg or nip fingers, so we do not recommend him with small children. We would love to see Rock in a home with a Schnauzer lover who has a home with a decent size yard for him to run and play in.      Like many of our rescued dogs, Rock still needs a little work on his house-training skills. He is eager to please however and very smart. He should be an easy boy to train. name: Moon
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Moon is a beautiful Poodle Terrier mix girl with a soft white coat and cream patches. She came to us after being hit by a car and her owner could not care for her nor afford her treatment. Moon's foreleg was badly damaged, and we tried for 2 months to save it but ultimately, it had to be removed. She gets along beautifully however, and it does not stop her much! Moon is 4 1/2 years old and weighs about 13 lbs. She is low shedding and easy to groom. She is very sweet and protective. According to her former owner she is housetrained and here at the rescue she is using a dog door that goes out to a protected area. Moon would prefer to be an only dog and would do best in a house instead of an apartment. She also should not have to go up and down stairs. She can navigate stairs but it would not be good for her to tackle stairs on a daily basis. Moon is a loving girl who has been through so much and is looking forward to having a forever home with someone who can be her very best friend. She is spayed, fully vaccinated and has had her teeth professionally cleaned.     Moon will require brushing and professional grooming every 6-8 weeks.      Moon's adoption fee is $450     This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog. location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Sweet Bonnie came to us as a pregnant stray who was running on the streets of Phoenix with 3 other dogs, all fending for their lives. She is brave, happy, loving, smart and a little bit sassy.   Bonnie has raised her litter and now is spayed and ready for a new home. She is likely a mix of Terrier, Poodle and perhaps a few other breeds. She is very affectionate, slightly wary of new people but very eager to please! Bonnie is very playful and enjoys playing with another dog. She loves to run and needs a good yard to run in. She is under 2 years old and weighs about 9 lbs. She is low shedding. Bonnie is learning to walk on a leash and she will need continued socialization to make her a happier more confident dog.   Bonnie is using a dog door that goes out to a protected area. She will need someone to go out with her to potty and praise her when she does. She will need to be taken out frequently until she learns to ask to go out. She is eager to please and is willing to learn.     Bonnie requires minimal grooming but regular nail trims.     Bonnie's adoption fee is $375    All adoptable dogs have had at least one health exam. name: Luka
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Luka is an adorable Poodle mix boy who may have some Maltese in him. He is very much a puppy still and is very playful with people and with other dogs. He is just over a year old and weighs about 9 lbs. He was surrendered by his owner because he had more energy than she remembered a puppy could have and her health was poor. She just cold not keep up with him or get him trained. He is walking on a leash and gets along with almost everyone. He is a little scared of kids upon first meeting but if they are calm and respectful, he adapts to them.   He still jumps on people (though very gently) and likes to stand on his hind legs and wave his hands (paws) at you in an act of play. He is silly at heart but very loving and attaches hard and fast to anyone who dares to love him. He would love another dog to play with but may be ok as an only dog with a yard to run in. He is also good in his crate.    Like many of our rescued dogs we are not sure how much housetraining Luka has. His owners said he was "mostly" trained.     Luka will require brushing and professional grooming every 6-8 weeks.     Luka's adoption fee is $450    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, spaying or neutering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee. story:

story:

She hoped to have a permanent home with her foster family but the resident dog didn’t agree! Athena tried so hard to make friends with the dog, but the dog wasn't in agreement. Athena loved to play and loved attention in her foster home, but now that she is in the shelter, the hustle & bustle of shelter life is a bit busy for her, so she is shy. What you see in the shelter is not her true personality. In the foster home she was engaging, curious and affectionate. She is a quiet kitty who doesn’t cause any trouble with the other cats and LOVES treats. Athena did a great job raising four boys, but now is ready for a home of her own. She is especially close to her son Jamie and would love to find a home with her cuddle buddy. This awesome kitty with her pretty golden eyes is sure to win your heart.

name: Mickey
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Bonjour! Mickey's the name and playing's my game! I'm your standard puppy with puppy energy, and being a cattle dog bumps that up a notch. I'm looking for a family to hopefully spend the rest of my life with. I was found as a stray up in New Mexico and I'm open to trying new things and have already settled in at HALO with the help of the lovely people that work here. My buddy Pumpkin and I like to go on walks together outside, he usually lets me lead the way and that's fine by me. I would do best in a house with a yard, but can be okay in an apartment if you love going on hikes (and take me with). I'm also a smart little cookie and know to take them gently if I really want it. If you're in the market for a loyal adventure buddy, comes swing by HALO and come meet me! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mickey, please reach out to the adoption group directly. name: Apollo
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Apollo is an adorably handsome Terrier mix boy who was found running the streets of Phoenix with 3 other dogs. He has a terrier coat and we have groomed him like a Schnauzer.   Apollo is about 2 years old and weighs about 11 lbs. He gets along very well with most of the other dogs and seems to like most people. He is walking on a leash and rides well in the car.   Apollo is funny and goofy and full of life! He enjoys playing with the other dogs and is a hoot to watch! He is an easy, happy go lucky little boy. He is not a big barker and not destructive but is a bit mischievous. He would love a yard to play in and a family of his very own to play with him.     Like many of our rescued dogs we are not sure how well house-trained Apollo is but he loves to please you and should be very easy to train if he is not!     Apollo is a coated dogs (hair grows continuously) and will require brushing and professional grooming but not as often as most coated dogs. He may shed but it would be very minimal.     Apollo's adoption fee is $400    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, spaying or neutering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.     If you have any questions or would like to adopt Apollo, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

She is approximately 5 months old and was rescued with her and siblings from a field on the outskirts of the city. She certainly would not have survived had she not been rescued. Clover is rambunctious and playful. Like most puppies, Clover will need a lot of training and of course, house training. She is already going out of the dog door though! She is currently about 29 lbs and her mother weighs about 40 lbs and she looks like a Lab/Shepherd mix with perhaps some Beagle? But we do not know who the dad was or if the same dad is the father of all of the puppies (YES, that is possible!) We can only speculate on the size these pups will be and if they will all be similar in size. Clover is spayed and has all of her vaccinations and is microchipped as well. Shes shy but friendly and gets along with everyone! name: Dixie
location: HALO Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Hello there I'm Dixie, I am a sweet and wonderfully cordial female who comes as one feline package! That's right I go home with my sister Jezebel, we're besties with each other and will want to be adopted together as a bonded pair! Think of it: twice the love twice the cuddles, and twice the lifelong joy! We do tend to be on the shy side, so we will thrive best in a quiet home! Starting out in a small, enclosed space (i.e. bathroom, pop-up crate, etc) where I will be easily interacted with until acclimated to the home. I should be slowly introduced to any resident pets to reduce stress. It may take weeks (to months if necessary) to acclimate. Positive encouragement during interactions (small amounts of wet food, treats, pets, etc.) is recommended to make positive associations. We need a special someone who's willing to be patient and spend quality time with us without expectations for a kitty that spends the day in their lap. We'll gladly cuddle and snuggle, and maybe one day even offer kisses to you once we're warmed up, but just know it might take a little work, and we are willing to try!*I am bonded to Jezebel. We must go home together.* If you have any questions or would like to adopt Dixie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Maggie
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Maggie is a loving Chihuahua mix girl who was found living on the streets of Mexico as a paralyzed dog. She came to our rescue and showed us how resilient, amazing and brave a dog can be. She clearly had litters of puppies while in this state and living on the streets and survived through it all. She is just a little bit of a thing weighing around 10 pounds and gets around quite well in her wheelchair. She is able to move herself around without of the chair as well. She does not always know when she has to go to the bathroom so she would be very difficult to housebreak but would do well in a diaper or similar. While a paralyzed dog is not for everyone she is definitely one we feel is deserving of a loving and forever home and her care is not terribly difficult. She is very healthy and very self sufficient. She is also independent and doesn't get along with all other dogs. She gets along with many but she is very protective of her food as one could understand from her years of living on the streets. Maggie is around five years old. We know it will take a special person to take on this special girl but she will give you so much love in return. She comes with her wheelchair and we will be glad to educate anybody who has not had experience before with paralyzed dogs.     Maggies adoption fee is $175    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, altering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee. name: Rosie (bonded to Chester)
location: ABC Animals Benefit Club of AZ City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
*Rosie is bonded to Chester*

All the wonderful things that people love about Labrador Retrievers are also the very same adjectives that completely describe Rosie ...  devoted, full of love, playful, smart, loving ... the list could go on forever. Rosie is a beautiful and loving yellow lab who is bonded to her brother Chester, who is a chocolate lab and is just as fabulous as she is. They love to cuddle with each other and love to play, play, play the day away! Rosie follows us around in the yard just to hang out and be close to us. She is putty in your hands when you pet her and she loves kisses too! These two fabulous dogs are waiting to be devoted to someone. We are suggesting a home without very small children only because the dogs need some training not to jump on people. They would accidentally knock over a child who isn't steady on their feet. Rosie and Chester are smart dogs who are eager to learn new things and they eager to please people. They love any type of toy and true to lab traits, they love to play in water. We got the wading pools back out for them so that they could splash around, but they love water from the hose too. If you are looking for a great pair of dogs whose tails never stop wagging, please inquire about Rosie and Chester. They are available for foster-to-adopt.

Chester is a completely gorgeous guy, both inside and out!  He is full of love and is always in a carefree good mood.  Chester and his sister, Rosie, are a bonded pair who are looking for a home together. They get along great together and love to play, play, play! They love whatever game you like ... maybe you like fetch or tug of war ... good news, they would love to play with you! They also are fascinated with water whether it be in our wading pools or straight out of the hose. Chester and Rosie are smart dogs whose main objective in life is to please people. Chester learned to sit in a heartbeat. (On second thought, maybe he already knew how to sit and was able to get extra treats out of us!) In all seriousness, they are eager to learn new things. They will need some training so that they don't jump up on people. Because they may accidentally knock over a small child, we are recommending a home without very small kids. These dogs are just so excited for attention and their tails never stop wagging! Don't tell Chester, but he is missing one ear flap. He is mum on how it happened, but he hears fine. name: Rambo
location: Arizona Shih Tzu and Small Breed Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Rambo is a handsome Lhasa mix boy who is ready for his forever home. He came to us as a stray and was not in the best condition. He is smart, adventurous and playful. He gets along with most of the other dogs. Rambo is estimated to be 3 years old and he weighs 20 lbs.     Like many of our rescued dogs we are not certain if Rambo is housetrained. He is using a dog door here and he is eager to please so he should be easy to finish up training with.     Rambo is a coated breed (hair grows continuously) so he will require frequent brushing as well as professional grooming ever 6-8 weeks.     Rambo's adoption fee is $400    This fee includes at least one health exam at our veterinarian while in our care, spaying or neutering, all vaccinations including rabies (as permitted by age), a pre-adoption professional grooming and a microchip with lifetime membership that never will cost you a fee.     All dogs also leave with a new collar and or harness and leash as well as a gift bag which includes among other things, a starter bag of the quality kibble that is being fed at the rescue.    Adoption fees also allow us the ability to put funds towards the next homeless or unwanted dog in need of rescue!  If you would like to be considered to for this adoption or any of our amazing rescues, please fill out the application with the help of this link. https://www.shelterluv.com/matchme/adopt/AZST/Dog.    We review each application carefully. Please understand that sometimes we get numerous applications for specific dogs and as a volunteer-based rescue, we do not always have the time to respond to each one. We do our best to choose the most suitable home for each dog based on their specific personality and needs.    Please note you MAY NOT be contacted for up to 10 days to schedule a meet and greet if your family is the most suitable for this rescue dog. Regrettably, we do not have the manpower currently to contact all applicants. We keep ALL applications in our database so please feel free to contact us when you see another dog of interest. We appreciate all applicants and do our best to pair ever dog and family for a successful and happy life.     If you have any questions or would like to adopt Rambo, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Max
location: Blue's Kitty Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
Max and his brother from another mother, Haboo, were living their best life in their forever home when their mom was tragically taken away from them. They are now looking for a new forever home where they will be accepted, loved, and spoiled. Max is a very friendly cat who loves making biscuits and getting hugs and rubs. He is very curious and very chill. While he is very adaptable, he needs to be in a home that will be best for his older brother, Haboo. His forever family will be a little older with no small children and no other cats. In their former forever home, they had a Corgi brother who Max loved and Haboo tolerated. We are looking for a loving, patient, and committed home for these two beauties as they have already been through a lot the past few months. 

They are FELV/FIV negative, and will be ready for their forever home on October 5 after they have completed their FVRCP and rabies vaccinations. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Max, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Timmy
location: North Phoenix Animal Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story:
IMPORTANT!! Due to time and staffing constraints, ALL inquiries/questions MUST BE accompanied by your completed Adoption Application (Matchmaking Questionnaire). 
To get the application email directly to CNPSrescue@gmail.com or see above for the link to the form. 
Any inquiries/questions sent without the completed form will NOT receive a response. Thank You for understanding.

Little Timmy is the sweetest, kindest, most loving 3  year old ever! He weighs 16 lbs and has the nicest personality. Timmy has two chronic conditions that his new family must understand: he has a cough that does not respond to any medications and he is unsteady on his back legs. However, nothing stops Timmy from living a full life, playing with his doggie friends and toys, and loving his humans non-stop (He uses his 4 legs  running around the house and fenced backyard).
Timmy has seen several prominent veterinarians and has been tested for every conceivable condition to no avail. The speculation from the medical professionals is that he was possibly exposed to distemper or a similar virus before he was born, and will always have a chronic cough and weakness in his back legs. These are not limitations for Timmy, and his wonderful personality more than makes up for any physical issues. Timmy is one in a million and is a delightful companion to humans (probably best with older children, no toddlers please) and to other dogs and cats, too. 
 Timmy is a very special boy who needs a very especial loving home that has experience and patience  with dogs with special needs as he does cough daily and sometimes he coughs up phlegm and at times, if he eats too fast, he can cough up his food.
He may cry at night if he needs to go potty and sometimes he may cry just because.
He doesn't like thunderstorms or the rain.
He does love laying in the sun.
He'll do best with a home with no stairs.
He will sleep in bed with you but needs help getting up and off the bed.
He uses the doggy door but he might "forget" if it's raining. 
Adoption fee of $150 includes his neuter, shots, and microchip If you have any questions or would like to adopt Timmy, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: CA/Nymeria (LA)
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: Please contact Kelsey for more information about this pet.Hello everyone!  My name is Nymeria (I was named after a dire wolf in Game of Thrones).  I’m a 6 year-old Brittany/Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever who weighs in at 40 pounds.  I’m very smart, lovable and affectionate towards humans.  I love to cuddle and follow my humans around the house all day, that is when I’m not running in my backyard or playing fetch.  Yes, I do need a good-sized yard that is securely fenced (6 feet).  I love long walks on the beach and love to run.  My foster mom said I am the perfect dog when it comes to interacting with people.    I am housebroken and kennel trained and know basic commands.  I learned the doggie door in a matter of seconds - I'm just that smart.   I’m spayed, current on vaccinations, heartworm negative and on monthly flee and heartworm preventative.    There’s just one thing:  I simply do not like other dogs.  When I was a puppy I was mauled by another dog and I have never gotten over that assault.  I must be the only dog in a home (no cats either).  I’m not the dog to take to a dog park nor to go on a walk with a friend and their dog.  My foster mom is a very experienced dog handler so she can take me on walks where I leave other dogs alone, but that’s because I know she has my back and will protect me.  In general, I need to be walked where I’m not going to be running into a lot of other dogs because it makes me very uncomfortable and I can reactive negatively.   Just so you know,  Nymeria was surrendered to NBRAN, not for this fear issue, but because her loving family were transferred overseas and could not take her with them.  They dearly loved Nymeria and raised a pup who is fabulous with humans.   If you understand the conditions above and are interested in adding Nymeria to your home, please complete an online application at www.nbran.org (under the Adopt tab).  Once you’ve completed your application you may email wanbran@comcast.net for more info or with questions.  You will be contacted by your state coordinator once your application has been received.  A telephone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process.    Transportation can be arranged up to 1400 miles (from LA) with the approved adopter being responsible for at least the last 100 miles.  Preference will be given to approved adopters who live closer to Nymeria’s foster home.December 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt CA/Nymeria (LA), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: CA/Mario (Bonded with Luigi)
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: Hi, I am Mario, Luigi’s big brother. I am good sized for a Brittany (54 pounds) and I’m all muscle. Everything that Luigi says applies to me (so check out his bio), except instead of fetching, I like to play keep away with the chuck-it ball to torment my brother.  So, if you want me to fetch, you will have to work with me.  Overall, even though I am larger, I am more of a cuddle bunny.  When we first came to our foster home, we didn’t like cars because all the trips were to the vet. Now we have learned to enjoy car rides.  Fortunately, neither of us has shown a desire to dig, which is good, because with our strength we could dig to China. We are much happier just running, sniffing and chasing vermin. We have demonstrated our prey instinct a couple of times, running down and killing field rats. We don’t eat them or anything, we just bring them to our foster dad to show off.  As my brother Luigi told you, we are best buddies, we like to sleep near each other, play like boys, chase after critters, and get into trouble together.  I should say we probably aren’t the best candidates for dog parks. If a little dog acts timid or runs, our prey instinct kicks in and we will chase him down.  We probably need a lot more socializing at dog parks with the bigger dogs before being allowed to roam freely. So, if you are looking for a dog that you can just let loose at the dog park for his exercise needs, we are not the right dogs for you.  The combined adoption fee for Luigi and me is $700 (discounted from the individual fees for two dogs) which helps offset our vetting and allows NBRAN to rescue more of these wonderful family members. If you are interested in making Mario and Luigi a part of your family, please complete the on-line application by visiting www.nbran.org. Once the application has been completed, you will be contacted by your state coordinator.  A phone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process. While Mario and Luigi can be transported up to 1400 miles to their new home, preference will be given to approved adopters who live closer to their foster home.  Mario and Luigi are both neutered, heartworm negative, current on their vaccinations, and microchippedDecember 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt CA/Mario (Bonded with Luigi), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: WA/Ollie (UT]
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: Ollie is an adorable, one year-old, 26 pounds Brittany/mini Eskimo dog mix.  He loves all people and dogs.  He wants to play non-stop and will need a home with another young dog to play with.  He also needs a home with a large yard that is securely fenced (6 ft).  Ollie has the softest, fluffiest coat and he wants to be with his humans as much as possible.  He is definitely a Velcro dog, except when he is playing chase with his foster brother or playing with his chewy toys.  Anyone adopting Ollie should be prepared to continue his manners training and should also realize that he will need daily exercise, including walks and running (once he is a little older).  Ollie is neutered, current on his vaccinations, heartworm negative, and microchipped.  He is crate and house-trained.  He will do fine in a home without kids, or in a home with older responsible kids, as long as he also has another dog in the home to play with.  Ollie’s adoption fee is $375.  If you are interested in making Ollie a part of your family, please complete the on-line application by visiting www.nbran.org (under the Adopt tab).  Once the application has been completed, you will be contacted by your state coordinator.  A phone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process.  Ollie can be transported up to 1400 miles to his new home from his foster home.  Please realize that NBRAN does not adopt on a first come, first serve basis.  We adopt our dogs to the best homes for each of their individual needs.December 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt WA/Ollie (UT], please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: WA/Sadie
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: Sweet Sadie came to us as an owner surrender when her family moved out of state and chose not to take her.  While Sadie lived her first 12 years outside she has quickly become acquainted with the good life living in a home with her foster family!!  She has learned to enjoy snuggles in dog beds and cozy blankets.  Sadie can often be found on the couch in their front room so she can keep an eye on all the action.     And don't think for a second that because Sadie is 12 that she wants to be left at home!  This determined girl prefers to be in front of her foster brothers on walks.  And she will do her best to "hunt" on those walks.  Indeed, Sadie is quite the strong girl when bunnies and birds are spotted.  She will need a family with Brittany or hunting dog experience who understands her “hunting” instinct, her strength, and need for daily exercise.  Sadie needs to go to a home where she will have a securely fenced (6 ft) yard to play in.  She will also need an active adopter committed to taking her on her daily walks.  And Sadie would love to continue the adventures she has had with her foster family, like hiking and camping.  She thinks those activities are just the best.  She would do fine in a home without children or with only older responsible children.  Because Sadie loves other dogs, a home with another furry pup is preferred.  Sadie also needs a home where all humans are steady on their feet, since she tends not to know she is under foot.  Sadie is current on her vaccines, spayed, heartworm negative , microchipped, and house-trained.   She is on Incurin twice a day for urinary incontinence and will need to stay on that medication.   Even with Incurin, we are looking for a home for Sadie where someone in the family is home during the day.  Sadie’s adoption fee is $250 ($150 for seniors over the age of 65).   If you are interested in making Sadie a member of your family, please complete the on-line application by visiting www.nbran.org (under the Adopt tab).  Once the application has been completed, you may email wanbran@comcast.net for more info or with questions.  A phone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process.  Transportation can be transported up to 1400 miles (from Seattle) with the approved adopter being responsible for at least the last 100 miles.  All our dogs are placed in the most appropriate home for their individual needs.  We do not operate on a first-come, first-serve basisDecember 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt WA/Sadie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: CA/Luigi (Bonded with Mario)
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: Hello, my name is Luigi.  My big brother Mario and I were born in October, 2018.  We are three years old.  I weigh 44 pounds and am very strong.  Mario and I are closely bonded so we will only be adopted together.  We get very anxious when we are separated, even for something as simple as a vet visit.  Much of what I tell you about myself applies to Mario so please read his bio also.  Our ideal family would be with active adults with lots of Brittany or sporting dog experience, who love the outdoors and athletics.  A home with mature, dog-savvy older teens would work also.  My brother and I are used to going on a four-mile speed walk every morning for a warm up and then we play all day.  We have strong prey drives, and love to chase butterflies, dragonflies, tweety birds, and squirrels.  Because of our prey drive, we cannot be in a home with cats.  I love to play with my chuck-it ball.  I am also an excellent swimmer.  My foster dad has a great pool and canyon area and we play outside 3-4 hours continuously every day.  We love to play in our foster dad’s pool, smell out lizards and other moving things in the fenced in canyon and just have a great time.  Like most boys, we like to roughhouse and when we get bored, we chew anything we can find.  We will tug you on a leash if you go slow, but love to move along at a fast clip or even a jog.  Any home we go to must have a secure, physical fence (at least 6 foot high).  Mario and I love to jump and can clear shorter fences either from a standing position or with a running start. When we look at chain link fences we see step ladders to freedom, no matter how high, so only a privacy fence will do.  So, what I am saying is that we need a forever home with a strong 6-foot (or higher) privacy fence and a large back yard for playtime.  We would love a pool but can make do with a children’s wading pool.  Over the last several months we have learned to sit, kind of stay, do a high-five handshake, and swirl in circles for treats.  We sit for cookies and chewies, and before a door is opened, and then barrel through with glee.  We are both fast learners and respond well to training.   After a day of exercise, we are very peaceful and full of cuddles.  We are fully crate-trained.  We call the crates our “house” and enjoy sleeping, eating and napping in the crate with the door open or closed.  If you close the door at night, we feel very secure and sleep through the night, if you don’t close the door, when it cools off, we will sneak up and get in bed to warm you up and cuddle.  Of course, we really want to sleep in the same room as our parent.  The combined adoption fee for Mario and me is $700 (discounted from the individual fees for two dogs) which helps offset our vetting and allows NBRAN to rescue more of these wonderful family members.  If you are interested in making Luigi and Mario a part of your family, please complete the on-line application by visiting www.nbran.org.  Once the application has been completed, you will be contacted by your state coordinator.  A phone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process.  While Luigi and Mario can be transported up to 1400 miles to their new home, preference will be given to approved adopters who live closer to their foster home.  Luigi and Mario are both neutered, heartworm negative, current on their vaccinations, and microchipped.December 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt CA/Luigi (Bonded with Mario), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: AZ/Toby (NM)
location: NBRAN Arizona City: Greensburg, PA
story: My name is Toby and I am the sweetest boy ever.  Somehow I found myself in a shelter and on a euthanasia list.  The wonderful staff at the shelter thought I was special boy who loves everyone and all other dogs so they contacted NBRAN who rescued me.  I am now looking for my forever home and family.  I am 14 months old, neutered, microchipped, fully vaccinated, and heartworm negative.  My mother as a Brittany and dad a healer.  I need an active family and an owner who will play with me.Anyone who adopts me should expect to continue with my manners and training.  I will need daily exercise.  To keep me safe, my new family is required to have a six foot privacy fence.  I like other dogs after a warm up period.  Cats are an unknown.  I am a little shy around men but loves females.  I look at my foster mom all the time with adoring eyes.  As long as I get my exercise, will be okay as an only dog.. I loves toys to keep me busy while my parents are doing their chores.  Little shy when you meet me so little children are not good for me .  Older children are fine as long they understand my timidness.  If you are interested in giving me a forever home, please go to http.//www.NBRAN.org and complete an application that you will find under the Adopt tab on the homepage.  Once the application has been completed, you will be contacted by your state coordinator.  A phone interview, home visit, and vet check will be required as part of the approval process.  All dogs are placed in the most appropriate home for their individual needs.  We do not operate on a first-come, first-serve basis.  My adoption fee is 325.00.  I can be transported up to1400 miles to my new home with preference being given to approved adopters who live closer to my foster.            December 15, 2022, 10:20 pm If you have any questions or would like to adopt AZ/Toby (NM), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

story: Jack (short for Jack-o-lantern) was found by a good citizen, he was frantically crying at her fence line on October 17th. He immediately allowed her to pick him up and put him into a dog crate. A local foster took him in as he was so sweet he was likely someone's pet, but no owner was found and he was underweight from his adventures. He is a low-key cat who is indifferent to the other cats and dogs but prefers to be left to his own space. He loves a chair for naps and will get very vocal about canned food and treats. Friendly, snuggly, and easy-going describes this young male, neutered orange and white cat. Jack is still adjusting to all the changes and will need to have an independent space to retreat to for breaks and to eat his food more slowly. He has not been around young children, but has done well with older children. Up to date on vaccines, neutered, and microchipped. name: Nikki
location: Pepper's Pals Rescue City: Peoria, AZ
story:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING NIKKI, PLEASE FIRST FILL OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION: https://pepperspals.org/adoption-application/

Hiking AND Travel Buddy Extraordinaire!! Saved from the county shelter, Nikki was scheduled to be put down for being scared, untrusting, and not walking on a leash. We have no record of what her life was like prior to arriving at the animal shelter, but from what we can tell, it was a very unkind one with her possibly being a bait dog. Despite her past, Nikki is a gentle soul who doesn’t have a mean bone in her body. She patiently allows all handling and is learning that human touch can be a good thing. We have been working on rebuilding Nikki’s confidence, and this girl has been a real trooper. She dutifully follows the humans she’s learned to trust, and she now walks like a pro on the leash!

Our veterinarian thinks Nikki is a younger pup – around 3 years old. At 38 lbs., Nikki is a smaller girl, and our best guess is that she is a Labrador/Border Collie Mix. While she isn’t a high-energy dog, Nikki LOVES to be moving and be outdoors! If you want a do-it-all hiking buddy, Nikki would love to accompany you. She doesn’t pull on the leash, and calmly walks past runners, bikers, and other dogs on the trails. Nikki settles easily in the car, and would be a great candidate for van life (Exploring new places every day? That’s right up her alley!). 

SPECIAL NOTE: While Nikki is part Labrador Retriever, it appears her lack of early socialization means she is not your typical happy-go-lucky spirit that most adopters tend to associate with labs. She is very much a project dog who needs a patient handler that is experienced in working with low-confidence dogs. An active handler is also a necessary requirement as movement activities (walks, hiking, parkour, etc.) are Nikki’s love language. She simply comes alive when she is doing something active by your side!

If you give her a chance, you’ll see Nikki is at heart a fun (sometimes goofy!) and curious dog that desires a connection with the world around her. Although Nikki had a rough start at life, we are certain there is a home out there that can continue to patiently polish her into the sparkling gem she was intended to be.

While our rescue typically does not adopt out beyond Phoenix, in order to best meet Nikki’s adventure needs, we will make an exception and accept applications from outside the Phoenix metro area.

**$200 Adoption fee includes: vaccinations, dewormed, spay, and microchip.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING NIKKI, PLEASE FIRST FILL OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION: https://pepperspals.org/adoption-application/. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Nikki, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Felix
location: Pepper's Pals Rescue City: Peoria, AZ
story:
PLEASE NOTE: We only do adoptions in the Phoenix valley and nearby cities - within a 50 mile radius of 85383.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING FELIX, PLEASE FIRST FILL OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION: https://pepperspals.org/adoption-application/.

Felix is a super easy-going boy and a true gem to have around. He is perpetually happy, thankful, and laid-back. Picked up as a stray from County, we believe Felix to be 8 - 9 years old. This boy is so sweet and lovable, everyone who meets him falls in love. Taking a short stroll around the neighborhood and greeting all the neighbors is one of his favorite things to do. He is potty-trained, kennel-trained, well-behaved, doesn't chew, travels well in the car, and is an overall low-maintenance dude. We have 6 other dogs here, and Felix coexists well with them. He prefers calmer, lower-energy dogs and does especially well with smaller dogs.

Felix was diagnosed with Valley Fever in July. Amazingly, his Valley Fever was caught early and his titer levels are on the lower end at 1:8. Valley Fever is a respiratory infection and is not contagious. Felix is currently on daily Fluconazole to help treat the infection. He will need to stay on the medication until the fungal infection clears up..

Thinking about fostering or foster-to-adopt? This boy is an easy-keeper and would make a perfect first-time foster. 

**$150 adoption fee includes: vaccinations, dewormed, neuter, and microchip.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING FELIX, PLEASE FIRST FILL OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION: https://pepperspals.org/adoption-application/. name: Ciara
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
*****Belgian Malinois Adoption requirements*****

The dog you have selected is a Belgian Malinois.  This is a breed that has very specific needs for an adoptive home.  Because of their need for a high level of exercise, both mentally and physically and their need for ongoing training, only applicants with demonstrated owner/handler experience with this breed will be considered.  The vast majority of them are not best suited as family pets, but in homes with experienced handlers knowledgeable of their needs and breed characteristics.  We will not place in homes with small children or small dogs/cats.  

Ciara is a very sweet lady but still has a lot of confidence building to do, especially around men. She is very unsure of new people and may take a bit to warm up. She may be particularly fearful of men but with the right home and a little patience she will come around and learn to trust. She seems to instinctively become protective around the people that she does know. She does need some work on containing her manners when she does become excited with familiar people. 

Ciara is an energetic lady who will benefit from an active and experienced owner. She becomes very affectionate when she is comfortable with you, she will climb in your lap or sit next to you and relax once she’s gotten her energy out. She has been known to become reactive to dogs but this seems to be solely fear based, she has come a long way in her reactions to other dogs and seems to become less reactive when she’s with a handler she feels safe with. Overall Ciara has so much potential to be a great best friend to someone with consistent training and a lot of love.

If you can give Ciara  an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/  

 We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organziation.  It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.

Thank you for your interest in saving a life! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Ciara, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Bernad
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Bernard aka “Bernie” is a handsome 4-5 year old German Shepherd who has been waiting for his perfect forever family to come along. Bernie is a special guy who is a volunteer favorite among many at the rescue. He has a few quirks which has caused him to be with us for quite some time. He will need a family with patience and commitment, and one who really understands the breed.

Bernie can be selective on the people in his friend group, so we will require that any potential adopter comes to meet Bernie multiple times to ensure it is a good fit and set Bernie up for success. Initial introductions will involve a muzzle, so please be aware of this. Once Bernie trusts you and builds a bond with you, he is an amazing, loving, happy and sweet boy. However it is important to know that in a home setting, anybody new coming into the house will need to take introductions very slow. German Shepherd experience is a requirement. 

German shepherds are known to have hip problems, and unfortunately Bernie is affected by this. In our care he has had 2 FHO (Femoral Head Ostectomy) Surgery’s to correct his hips. However one of his hips never healed properly so he does have a limp on that leg from time to time. 

Bernard is an awesome boy once you take the time to get to know him. He is smart and loves his people. He will need a home without children and would do best as an only dog. If you are willing to give Bernie a chance, please fill out an adoption application.

If you can give Bernard an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/ 

We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization. It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.
Thank you for your interest in saving the life of a dog. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Bernad, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Carmen
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Name: Carmen
Age: 3 years old
No small children, dogs or small pets
Review Malinois adoption requirements below

Howdy, my name is Carmen! Believe it or not I just finished raising 14 puppies! Whew, am I ready to focus on a little "me time". I want to have a person of my own. I will do best with someone who is home a lot. I'm a Malinois and meant to be with my person a lot. We can do so many fun things together - hiking, playing ball, dog sports, going on road trips (I love the car) and just hanging watching tv. I need someone who really understands my breed. I'm not really the right dog to train you about how to own a Malinois. 

I'm pretty young as you can see from my pretty white shiny teeth! (they tell me about 1 - 1 1/2 years old). I walk well on a leash and not reactive to people or other big dogs or horses. I am not a fan of the little yippy dog types so think cats might fall into that category too. 

If you can give Carmen an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/ We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization. It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks. Thank you for your interest in saving a life!

*****Belgian Malinois Adoption requirements*****

The dog you have selected is a Belgian Malinois. This is a breed that has very specific needs for an adoptive home. Because of their need for a high level of exercise, both mentally and physically and their need for ongoing training, only applicants with demonstrated owner/handler experience with this breed will be considered. The vast majority of them are not best suited as family pets, but in homes with experienced handlers knowledgeable of their needs and breed characteristics. We will not place in homes with small children or small dogs/cats. Must be previous owner/handler to be considered If you have any questions or would like to adopt Carmen, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Leah
location: Arizona Golden Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Leah, a beautiful 58 pound, 5-year-old female English Crème Golden Retriever. She was surrendered with her littermate brother, Baxter, (22-082) a handsome 80 pound, 5-year-old male English Crème Golden Retriever. Neither is particularly alpha nor had any training or been walked on a leash. Left alone to their own devices. they can be escape artists led by Baxter. They will require supervision and a secure yard with 6 foot fencing and secure gates.  Leah is quiet, soft and submissive. She loves to fetch and also to shake hands and be petted. She follows Baxter around. Baxter is a confident explorer and lizard hunter, not interested in retrieving but does like attention. They were both tentative about getting into a vehicle but once in, rode quietly.  Leah and Baxter are a loving, high energy, happy to be us bonded pair and we will place them together. We are looking for an active family with the time and desire to spend quality time with them, willing to train them with patience and positive reinforcement obedience training.  If you believe you are the lucky family for Leah and Baxter, visit our webpage http://arizonagoldenrescue.rescuegroups.org/info/adoption and complete an Online Adoption Application ASAP to begin the process. (Please be aware that your application cannot be processed until the application fee is paid.)  We place our dogs into vetted approved homes based upon best match for their needs. All potential fosters and adopters must complete an application, pay the $25.00 application fee and have a home visit before being considered for any dog. Once your home visit is approved, if Leah and Baxter are spoken for, you will be placed on our waiting list.  Prior to adoption, all AGR dogs are given a full vet exam, including valley fever and heartworm tests, brought up to date on all vaccinations, given a microchip, neutered or spayed, and treated for any medical problems.  If you have specific questions about our adoption process, please go to this link at our website.   https://arizonagoldenrescue.rescuegroups.org/info/display?PageID=20779Visit this organization's web site to see any additional information available about this pet.December 15, 2022, 11:55 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Leah, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Booker / Archer (Adoption Pending)
location: Arizona Golden Rescue City: Glendale, AZ
story: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.(PLACED) Booker is spoken for.    All potential fosters and adopters must complete an application, pay the $25.00 application fee and have a home visit before being considered for any dog.  If you reside in Arizona and are interested in adopting a dog like Booker from Arizona Golden Rescue, we recommend that you visit our website and complete the Online Adoption Application to begin the process.    http://arizonagoldenrescue.rescuegroups.org/info/adoption   WE DO NOT ADOPT OUTSIDE OF THE STATE OF ARIZONA. Once we receive your application and  application fee, a home visit will be scheduled. Once your home visit is approved, you will be placed on our waiting list. (Please be aware that your application cannot be processed until the application fee is paid.)   Our sole purpose is to find the perfect home for the dog as our dogs always come first.     Because we have new rescues coming in all the time, if the Golden that is the right dog for you is not available at this time it will probably come into Rescue and you would be notified of the availability.     Waiting times vary depending upon how specific your preferences are. The more you restrict the factors involved in choosing a dog – age, sex, coat color, etc. – the longer the wait may be before we find the perfect dog for you.   Please note: it is the policy of AGR not to place a dog less than 3 years of age with a family that has children less than 3 years of age.   If you have specific questions about our adoption process, please go to this link at our  website.    https://arizonagoldenrescue.rescuegroups.org/info/display?PageID=20779   Arizona Golden Rescue is organized as an all-volunteer, non-profit, 501 (c) (3) corporation. We are a charitable organization whose mission is to rescue displaced Golden Retrievers and mostly-Golden mixes that have been abused, abandoned, neglected or unwanted and find new, loving, permanent homes for them. Rescued dogs are given a complete veterinary exam and their vaccines are updated; they are also micro-chipped, spayed or neutered, and tested for valley fever and heartworm. AGR provides emotional and medical rehabilitation and will pay for medications and for necessary surgeries. Through education at public appearances, AGR seeks to educate the public about the Golden Retriever breed and about responsible dog ownership, in order to help reduce the unwanted dog population.     Booker is a 7-month-old male Golden Doodle who was returned to rescue as his first family did not work out. He had been originally surrendered to rescue when he was only 9 weeks old as his original owner could not afford medical needs for him.  The family he was initially placed with did not have time to train him due to a change in family circumstances and jobs.  Booker is a tall, rowdy boy with a lot of energy looking for his forever home.  He will be neutered at AGR's expense as soon as he is old enough.           Visit this organization's web site to see any additional information available about this pet.December 15, 2022, 11:55 am If you have any questions or would like to adopt Booker / Archer (Adoption Pending), please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Jynova
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Hi, my name is Jynova and I was surrendered because my humans had me in an apartment and the big bad landlord said no. 

Off I went to the county shelter and these nice people at SPR saved me. 

I am probably a super mutt but I look a little like a small malinois. I have the attitude of a giant dog and I will try to take on any dog large or small. 

SPR says it's probably best if I’m an only dog. I tell you though, I am a lover and a player! 

I scoot around as fast as I can when I’m playing. I AM FAST!

If you’re looking for a companion that can you can give all your attention to, I am your girl! 

Ps: I’ve never met a cat, and I probably won’t like them.  

Please contact SPR to get on my calendar and come visit me.  https://www.savingpawsrescueaz.org/ If you have any questions or would like to adopt Jynova, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Lexie
location: Saving Paws City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Lexie is a 3-year-old German shepherd who is such a love bug. She walks well on a leash, knows some basic commands and enjoys hiking, playing catch, and swimming. Due to her amazing athletic abilities and willingness to please, Lexie would make an excellent agility dog. She gets along with most dogs she meets and is great with children. Lexie will sometimes bark at strangers, but she will stop once she gains more confidence and gets more exposure to new people and places. She is a volunteer favorite and she will roll over for belly rubs and attention. She recently stayed the night at a volunteer’s house so we know she is potty trained and good with chickens and horses. Come and meet your dream dog, Lexie is waiting to meet you! 
 
We will only schedule meet and greets with an approved application. We are an all-volunteer organization.  It may take a couple of days to process an application and complete reference checks.

Thank you for your interest in saving the life of a dog.

If you can give Lexie  an indoor forever home, please fill out our online application on our website at http://www.savingpawsrescueaz.com/adoption-form/ If you have any questions or would like to adopt Lexie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. location: All About Animals Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Michonne is a mostly deaf kitty that is in no way impaired.  She can be very vocal, especially at night when she is getting used to a new environment. This is a normal/common behavior for kitties who do not realize how loud they can be. We recommend that she be given time to adjust to the new environment, and also that she is given lots of attention and playtime so she will be more likely ready to rest when it is time for bed. She is playful but can get overstimulated so no small children.  Loves to sleep in the bed, on your shoulders.  Get her some cardboard boxes with paper in them or wand toys!  Est. name: Mimi
location: All About Animals Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story: Mimi is a silky soft, medium coated house panther who found herself becoming a very young mom at just under a year. Yet, she has raised three healthy kittens despite having been a stray prior to her rescue. Now it's her turn to have a second chance at kittenhood. She's timid but super sweet and playful. She has been busy with kittens and hasn't become a lap cat but does love getting snack and will come and ask for pets. name: Ali
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
HELLOOO new family! I am so excited to meet you! I'm gonna have you giggling nonstop because I'm so happy and goofy. I was born without the piece of my brain that helps me balance (*cerebellar hypoplasia), so I wiggle all over the place. Basically I just love to dance funky all the time! I'm probably gonna be famous soon, so you should adopt me before the pup-parazzi finds me and the whole world wants in on this cuteness. And don't worry, I'm not going to get any worse--I just need you to love me as I am: crazy dancer but always happy to see you. Bonus? I'm already kennel & potty trained. Just because I'm goofy doesn't mean I don't know how to behave! Contact Mayday if you'd like to meet me and I promise to show you all my moves!

Ali might be good with older children and would do best in a home without other dogs.

*Cerebellar hypoplasia is a permanent neurological condition that causes permanent balance and coordination issues. Cerebellar hypoplasia causes jerky movements, tremors and generally uncoordinated motion. The animal often falls down and has trouble walking. To manage this condition for your pet, it is vital that you understand your pet's physical limitations. As your pet may have difficulty controlling movement, you may need to assist your pet when eating and drinking. Providing your pet with a safe environment is essential. Due to the imbalance and wide stance, stairs and uneven ground may cause a hazard. A non-slip, flat surface, such as carpeting, is an ideal environment for your pet.*

If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

name: Tinkerbell
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
I'm a lover! I love people. Getting and giving attention and affection is my specialty. I'm great with other dogs! I love the outdoors! I was born to sunbathe and play in the dirt. I have my own special way of walking since I have two legs. I can outrun you if i wanted to but I'd much rather have you love on me. Majestic, grace, resilience, affectionate, calm, happy, loving, survivor, and feisty are just some of my descriptors. I am paralyzed from the waist down so I have no control over my bladder or bowels and I dribble a bit when I walk. It's been a while since I tried a diaper, since I love being outside so much, it hasn't been necessary. I was rescued from Saudi Arabia where doctors believed I was hit by a car which left me paralyzed. I was left in the streets to fend for myself while dragging my legs until some kind people took me in and helped me heal. I am now ready to find my forever home where people will love me for how affectionate I am and not judge me based on how I look. I had a rough go of it but my resilience and will to live shine brighter than any diamond or star in the sky. Would you like to be greeted by my warm smile and affectionate gaze everyday when you come home? Email Mayday today!

*As someone who knows Tinkerbell and has witnessed her love in person, I get goosebumps just thinking about how amazing this girl is. Nothing would bring me more happiness than seeing her in a home of her own. She has traveled from across the globe, been through hell and back, and it still amazes me every day how sweet she is. No other creature on this planet gives love like that of a rescued dog.*

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

story:
Meet Mr. Archie! This adorable fuzz ball was rescued from a hoarding situation where he was not socialized with any strangers. Every day is a chance to see him open up and becoming more trusting of humans. Even though he has made great strides with his foster family, he will be a long term investment for the right adopter - one that will be rewarding and worth the work put in!

Archie has met and played with other dogs and rough houses with his foster moms dog. He would do well with a dog companion that is social and friendly and willing to allow him space to decompress. 

When you first pick up this boy, he will be stiff and uncomfortable, but he does soften and enjoy his pets. He loves blankets and sitting on the couch and bed - he learned creature comforts pretty fast! He knows his crate as well and has come a long way on potty training. 

We do suggest older children or a child free household as he is not ready to commit to being grabbed, picked up quickly, or kissed. name: Ozzy
location: The Pet Knot City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Meet Ozzy!

Ozzy is CUUUUTE & he KNOWS it! 
Let's get right into it! This guy's ideal home is somewhere with no kids & no other dogs. I know that's a bummer -- but don't let it sway you from this awesome guy! 

Ozzy is so smart!! Learns quickly & aims to please. 

He's nonreactive to other animals. What does this mean? It means when you're out walking him or hiking or whatever -- he's not going to be lunging & going nuts when he sees another dog. He has played well with some dogs but can also be selective with others so he is best as your sole companion. He definitely wouldn't be a dog you could take to the dog park. 

He thrives with exercise, training & structure! He is great in a crate, knows the doggie door, great on a leash. LOVES to play & just an all around awesome dude. He would do so well with someone that was active, played ball & games with him every day and worked with him daily! He's a WORKING DOG. Aussies were bred to herd cattle. He'd be amazing with a job like that! Since a lot of us don't have cattle -- we have to get creative to keep him stimulated and his little mind working :) There are SO many fun ways to work him and make sure he gets the exercise he needs -- no cattle required! 

His adoption fee is waived to the right home! 
He is neutered, vaccinated & microchipped. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Ozzy, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Donna
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Happiness is a choice and I choose it every day! I had a rough start to life and have unique legs to show for it, but I don't let that dampen my cheerful spirit. Even my ears are spunky! Morning zoomie spins are my specialty! I twirl and swirl like a dainty ballerina, after she's had a cup of coffee! I love to have fun and will have you giggling more than you thought possible. I'm also really great at snuggly naps. Have some fluffy blankets? Count me in! And I won't chew on those blankets, I save it for my chew toys. I love cozying up close to my favorite people! I have bowed legs but do not require any surgery or medications. I would do best in a home without other animals as I want to be your one and only. Looking for an easy girl who is happy to hang out around home? It's me!! Contact Mayday today to find out more about me!

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

name: Janey Rico
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
I am the perfect snuggle companion, and I love people! I was born with deformed front legs so I walk more on my wrists, but it certainly doesn't stop me from climbing into your lap and into your heart or playing tug of war with toys. I'm curious, smart, friendly, happy, goofy, and like to lie on your feet. Kiddie-sized pools are my favorite way to cool off! I would love a home where I can lounge about chewing a toy and be the queen of the castle along with my best doggie pal, Captain Wigglesworth. We're an inseparable odd couple. Where I go, he goes. Even though I can be a little bossy with him and I get sassy with toys, he doesn't mind. He just does his own thing. I'm not potty trained yet, but I can learn.

Dog introductions are required because I can be selective on who I choose as a friend, which is why my bond with Wigs is so special. Contact Mayday today to meet me and my bestie and see how great we are together!

Jigs? Waney? Dude N' Tude? No matter what we title this dynamic duo, the key is that Janey and Wigs love being together and we can't bear to separate them. Janey's outgoing personality helps Wigs bridge the gap his shy demeanor can create with humans. And Wigs gives Janey the unfaltering love and companionship she craves, despite her bossy 'tude. They're both a little different and they embrace that, which is something we'd love to see more of in this world.

Check out my buddy's profile, Captain Wigglesworth, to find out more about him!

If you, or someone you know, are interested in adopting or fostering, please visit our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or send us an email at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

story:
