name: Godiva
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Looking for the perfect amount of cuteness and sass? How about a master snuggler? Then Godiva is the perfect dog for you! She's fun, brave, and loves to play with toys. She also goes bonkers for chasing water from the hose. She's a happy, bouncy young pup. She takes a minute to warm up to new people but when she does she's a stage 5 clinger begging for belly rubs. It's impossible to say no to her with those big golden puppy dog eyes of hers.

She's great with dogs of all sizes once she gets to know them but she'd also be happy to be your one and only. She's also good with children.

She was born with deformed front legs but that doesn't stop her from racing around after toys or leaping onto couches in a single bound. She can briefly support herself on her strong back legs only, like a kangaroo, but also uses her longer front leg to walk. She's not in any pain and does not require corrective surgery at this time.

This super sweet, smart, goofy girl is ready to find her forever family! If you think that could be you, contact Mayday today to meet her!

name: Captain Wigglesworth (aka CW)
location: Mayday Pit Bull Rescue & Advocacy City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Ahoy mates, I'm Captain Wigglesworth! But as my future family, you can call me CW or Wigs or Wiggy for short. I'm pretty rad so I gotta have more than one cool nickname, right?!  I walk a little sloppy but don't you worry, the doc said I'm all good! I was born with cerebellar hypoplasia, which means I'm missing the part of my brain that would help my balance--thus the goofy walk. But it won't get worse and I won't need meds, so how's that for a win?!

My bestie Janey and I go everywhere together, she keeps me balanced. I'm a little shy meeting new people, but Janey helps me feel comfortable. And once I open up, I'm a happy, playful pup! Ready to take us home together?  Message Mayday and tell them you want to meet the cutest fella on the block! I get along with other dogs but Janey decides which ones, so also tell my Mayday peeps if we might have siblings at home. We're going to have so much fun together!

Jigs? Waney? Dude N' Tude? No matter what we title this dynamic duo, the key is that Janey and Wigs love being together and we can't bear to separate them. Janey's outgoing personality helps Wigs bridge the gap his shy demeanor can create with humans. And Wigs gives Janey the unfaltering love and companionship she craves, despite her bossy 'tude. They're both a little different and they embrace that, which is something we'd love to see more of in this world.

Check out my buddy Janey's profile to learn more about her!

Captain Wigglesworth has *cerebellar hypoplasia. **Cerebellar hypoplasia is a permanent neurological condition that causes permanent balance and coordination issues. Cerebellar hypoplasia causes jerky movements, tremors and generally uncoordinated motion. The animal often falls down and has trouble walking. To manage this condition for your pet, it is vital that you understand your pet's physical limitations. As your pet may have difficulty controlling movement, you may need to assist your pet when eating and drinking. Providing your pet with a safe environment is essential. Due to the imbalance and wide stance, stairs and uneven ground may cause a hazard. A non-slip, flat surface, such as carpeting, is an ideal environment for your pet.*

If you are interested in adopting or fostering, please check out our site at www.maydaypitbullrescue.org or email us at info@maydaypitbullrescue.org

name: Paisley
location: Paws 4 A Cause Arizona City: Cave Creek, AZ
story: I've had it rough and am so confused!  I was on the streets and ended up being brought to the shelter where things were really loud and scary.  I went to a foster and just began to relax and feel loved when they had to move and couldn't foster me anymore.  Then I went to a new foster where they have taken me in and understand that other dogs now scare me a bit.  It's been a long time since I got a lot of attention and now its all I want!  I tolerate their female dog, but she's a bit too crazy for me.  I really just want a place of my own where I can hang out on my dog bed, go for long walks, wake you up with kisses and snuggle with my family all the time!  I know to go potty outside and my foster doesn't like me on the furniture so I'm being really good for them.  I do like to play with my toys and chew on a toy, but mostly I just really like to be wherever my people are.  I love my foster family, but I really want a home of my own where I can finally be loved and be the one and only.  I do like kids too!  I've had all my shots, and no more babies for me (thank goodness).  And I guess I'm microchipped too so my family can always find me, but once I'm home, that's the only place I'll ever want to be.  Will you love me - even though I'm a little older?  I promise to be good! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Paisley, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Cooper
location: Paws 4 A Cause Arizona City: Cave Creek, AZ
story:
Cooper
I am Cooper – I’m about 3 years old. I’m not really sure because I was homeless for some time. I’ve been at Paws 4 A Cause for about a 18 months. I was in training to be a service dog, but because I can get a bit protective of my owner, I guess I didn’t quite complete the program.
I love to gently play and get along with most other dogs at my rescue as long as we are introduced nicely. I am a good snuggler and comforter, and I get really attached to my human. I’m a bit afraid of strangers, especially when they come into my home, so my foster mom just asks me to kennel up and I just hang out there until they leave.
I walk really well on a leash. I’m also chipped so I never get lost again. I’ve been neutered (ouch!!), and had all of my shots. My ideal family would be a person that lives alone and just wants to hike, walk and snuggle. My foster family would give you my kennel so they know I’ll be safe and not afraid of strangers in your home.
Will you be my forever human? If you have any questions or would like to adopt Cooper, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Mia
location: Paws 4 A Cause Arizona City: Cave Creek, AZ
story:
MIA    
 	
 	Mia has had quite the journey this year. Not one that any dog would like to have. Our goal is to ensure that Mia’s journey ends with a forever loving home. She is so very deserving! Mia’s backstory: Mia had a home earlier this year but her owner sadly passed away. She was rehomed to another gentlemen who only had her 3 days before she was on the run. A neighbor caring for his plants the day she got out asked for HARTT’s help. It took approximately 10 days with sighting of her out in the desert to successfully get her safely. At the time of her trapping her new owner had gone out of town, had a stroke and a couple weeks later succumbed from the complications. Mia was homeless again.  After spending time with a HARTT volunteer a foster was found and Paws 4 A Cause took her into rescue. 

Mia was in a foster for a short time but as she bonded with the humans her fondness of the other dogs became less. Due to this Mia came back to the HARTT volunteers house. 

About Mia: Mia is a healthy German Shepard/Husky mix. She is estimated to be ? years old. She weighs approximately XX pounds. She is spayed and up to date on her shots. Mia is a lover of all people. She is happy just to be with her people. It is recommended in her new home that any kids in the household be older. This is only due to the fact that Mia does not realize her size and can jump up when excited. Because of her bond with humans it is recommended that Mia be an only dog. She has more than enough love to give! 

Mia is leashed trained, house trained, and dog door trained. Has a couple tricks as well such as sit, stay and shake. She would prefer not to be in a kennel and is non destructive when left to be on her own.

Mia would great with any single owner or family! Please consider giving Mia her forever home and closing out her chapter of being homeless. If you have any questions or would like to adopt Mia, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Sparrow Spazball
location: AZ CLAWS Animal Rescue City: Phoenix, AZ
story:
Goose and Sparrow are adorable brothers. They were saved from a super-sketchy parking lot with their siblings. These boys needed some TLC and love and now they are ready to take on the rest of their lives. They are neutered, vaccinated, microchipped.They are strictly indoor cats ONLY. Their adoption fee is $200.00.

Goose is such a lover. He likes belly rubs, kisses, and lap time with his foster mom. He is one of the most affectionate kids ever. His head bumps when he wants his foster mom's attention. He is just a sweet boy. His favorite thing to do is play with little mice. He truly believes he's a great hunter and we let him think that.  He likes hanging out in his tower by the window where he can check out the birds flying by. He is a perfect cat for a family looking for a kitty to hang out with who is also fun, playful, and super cuddly.  

Sparrow is super-curious. If you leave something out that is new, this kid is checking it out. He likes sitting and watching his foster mom do things around the house. We joke that he's plotting to take over! Sparrow is outgoing and LOVES to play with his siblings. He is more of an independent cat, seeking affection from other cats. 

These kids free-feed on dry food, eat wet food a couple of times a day, and may just be addicted to their fav treats - Churu! 

If you are looking for brothers that will entertain for hours, check out Goosey and Sparrow. They have very different personalities which makes them the perfect duo! If you have any questions or would like to adopt Sparrow Spazball, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.

name: Millie
location: ARIZONA ANIMAL RESCUE ALLIANCE City: phoenix, AZ
story:
We do NOT ship a animals to other states.
Millie is a very sweet dog that just wants a peaceful home with good food, daily walks and lots of chill time with her owner. 
She came into rescue after a few unsuccessful attempts for owner to rehome her and the reason being is that they could no longer afford her grooming costs, deposits for apartment and they are having a baby.
She is still settling in and so we are still learning more about her. 
She will require monthly grooming, and she has gingivitis, which means she needs dental work. This is a health issue that has come up with Millie's vet visit. 
We will only adopt to a family that is in a stable living situation, preferably with a yard and someone who enjoys taking walks and dog park. Miliie likes to be active 
She is an AKC registered dog.

Update :
Millie is getting her dental on the 15th and will be available to meet around the 17th.
Her price has went up to offset our costs.

Adoption fee:$1200 If you have any questions or would like to adopt Millie, please reach out to the adoption group directly. PetSmart Charities does not facilitate the adoption process. Thank you.
